prom2.einformation_7new_mechanics.quests: &7All shields have new mechanics from the &eShield Overhaul&7 mod.
- &e&lBashing &r&7Attack while blocking to perform a shield bash. &7This will stun the target for 1 second, unless it's a boss.
&7Combat mechanics were altered by the &eBetter Combat&7 mod.
- &6&lWeapons &r&7Each weapon has its own attack animation and time.
- &6&lHold to attack &r&7You can hold the attack button to keep attacking continuosly.
&7This tutorial questline explains how combat works, from changed mechanics to how to build yourself.
&eAlthough this is an early game tutorial, it extends up to end game builds. More quests will appear as you progress.
&7Most of this questline is just reading, &cplease make sure to read&7 if you want to truly understand things, as it's important information.

&7The following guides will direct you what to look for depending on specific build types. These are not fully fleshed builds, they're just guides for you to follow on what gear to choose depending on your gameplay.
&eThe difficulty shown applies to both how hard it is to play it, and how hard it is to make the build &7(Although gameplay difficulty has more priority)&7.
&eThis part of the questline can get complex! To learn more about getting Skill Books please read the Spellcasting questline.
&6For full guides on specific builds, check the official wiki!
&eHow do I know what gear to get?
&7Stats, also known as attributes, are a series of numbers associated to your character which allow other things to scale from.
&7For example, Haste defines how fast you attack, while health defines how much health you have, etc.
&7The next quests will explain the main stats and how each is important for what use specifically.
&eStats are a core part of your gear, it's important that you understand what stats you need and which you don't depending how you want to build yourself.
&eCore Stats are the stats that everyone uses to an extent.
&7Either because you already have a default amount (like Health) or because any piece of gear will give the stat (like Haste and Armor)
&eVarious statistics that are designed for ranged options.
&7While Physical Damage is used by everyone, ranged builds will prefer other statistics depending on what path they take; &eArchery&7 (Ranged Physical) or &eSpellcasting &7(Ranged Magic)
&7Magic can also be used by melee, with Spellblade builds.
&7Making you attack or switch weapons faster. It also scales with certain weapons and items. Particular focus for \"Rogue\" builds, or any fast attacking build.
&eIncreases the amount of damage your swings/punches deal.
&7The main statistic for melee builds, as it increases the damage you deal and scales with anything that deals physical damage, such as melee weapons and melee abilities.
&7It's obtained from armor pieces, but enemies and bosses will also have an amount armor by default.
&7Reduces the incoming &6Physical Damage&7 at a higher range. It's more effective on high damage hits, hence why it's known as the \"Anti One Shot\" stat.
&7Increases the maximum amount of damage you can take until you die.
&7Decreases the amount of Energy (Hunger) you lose passively.
&eElemental powers are the third strongest to exist, also known as &otertiary&r&e powers.
&7Although there are other tertiary powers, Elemental ones come from the Creation, Holy and Soul.
&eArcane, Frost and Fire&7 can be used by various Spell Books, alone or together, they're all three part of the &eAstral &7hybrid power.
&eLightning&7 is used by some weapons like the Thunderwrath artifact, consists of an important power for Valkyries.
&ePrimordial Powers are the second strongest, also known as Secondary powers.
&eHoly&7 is used by Priests and Paladins to support allies.
&eSoul&7 is used in combination of Elemental powers, to form hybrid powers such as &eSoulfire&7 and &eSoulfrost&7, used mainly by some Artifacts.
&eDecaying powers are the powers of Death.
&eBlood&7 is used by Blood Death Knights, a tank specialization that sustains itself.
&eUnholy&7 is used by Unholy Death Knights, bruisers that bring diseases to enemies.
&eHybrid stats either are a mix of two stats, or a stat that applies globally to both melee and ranged classes.
&eLethality and Magic Penetration are the same stat with different names. They ignore a percentage of your target's Armor or Magic Protection.
&7For example, if you have 16%% Lethality and your enemy has 100 armor, you'll hit them as if they had 84 Armor instead (as it reduces their armor -16%%).
&eAstral Power is the combination of 3 elemental powers: &dArcane, &cFire&e and &bFrost&e.
&7This hybrid power is used by Astral Mages, or by Astral Spellblades. With artifacts such as &dSingularity&8 (from Ekavar)&7 and &dSupernova&7 scaling with these stats.
&7There are spell books that use Astral Power too, such as the &dRunic Invocations&7 book.
&7Increases the specific spell power by a percentage of your Physical Damage.
&7Increases your Phyiscal Damage by a percentage of your amount of the specified spell power.
&7This stat scales the damage dealt with Ranged Weapons that throw projectiles, such as bows, crossbows or guns. It's obtained through Talents, Jewelry and from the ranged weapons themselves.
&7This stat increases the draw speed from a bow/crossbow, or the rate of fire from guns/cannons.
&eThese powers buff the casting process of Spellcaster Mages.
&eSpell Critical Chance&7 increases the chance of your spells to deal critical damage.
&eSpell Critical Damage&7 increases the damage of your critical spells by a percentage.
&eSpell Haste&7 increases the speed of your casts, making them shorter.
&7It also scales with other things like Rolling.
&eEnchantments are a core part of your gear, they heavily increase the efficiency of your gear.
&7You can check the full enchanting guide on the wiki, the Enchanting tutorial is currently being built <3
&eProtectors (Also called Tanks) are supports that focus on protecting others by taking the damage from enemies.
&7Protectors focus towards being the first to attack enemies, or taunt them using active talents such as &9Bone Armor&7.

&7As a protector your main priority should be &cMaximum Health&7 and &eArmor&7. The best pieces with these stats are &eDiamond Armor&7 and its upgrades, as they'll provide the maximum amount of Armor points (and Toughness) as possible, and later on also Maximum Health.
&eKeep in mind that a tank's damage is mediocre compared to other builds. Its purpose is to tank, not to deal damage.
&eWarriors are melee builds that swing slow but hard.
&7They are the definition of a \"Burst\" class; as although they swing slow their damage will be high, just not as constant as a DPS build.
&eMages are versatile ranged builds that use magic of certain elements such as Arcane, Fire and Frost.
&7A Mage's job is to deal damage from a distance using magic casted from a Spell Book.

&7Your priority will depend on the path you decide to take; the element your want to focus on. As starting gear, you can get a &eWizard Staff&7 (or any staff of the specific element) and &eWizard Robes&7.
&eUnlock Tier II Guides for Specific Elements
&eRogues are melee builds that focus on attacking fast, dealing constant damage to targets.
&7They are the definition of a \"DPS\" class; the focus is towards constant damage, unlike Burst builds which are focused towards high damage without being constant.
&7Stat-wise the main priority is &eHaste&7, then &6Physical Damage&7. Gear-wise you should look for fast attacking weapons that are one-handed so you can dual wield them.
&eRangers are ranged builds that use weapons such as Bows, Crossbows or Guns to deal damage using projectiles.
&7They can be built as a DPS-oriented build, or Burst-oriented build, depending on the gear you take and stats you prioritize.
&7Main priority is &2Ranged Damage&7, obtained from talents and the gear you're using. If you want a faster fire rate, then you should also prioritize &aDraw Speed&7.
&eKeep in mind that archers are squishier.
&eAn alternative path that combines both Rogues and Mages.
&7With spellblades you can be a melee rogue that uses magic abilities. You can start with a Spellblade of any element you'd like, and its Techniques spellbook for the abilities.

&7Priorities should be a mix of both Physical Damage and the elemental power of your choosing. Fate choice can be either the fate of your element, or &9Shadow Techniques&7 if focusing more on attacking than spells.
&eThe Runic Invocations use Astral Magic, power from three elements: Arcane, Fire and Frost.
&7Runic Invocations are very strong when used right, but are the most difficult mages.
&7Now that you've reached enough level to get a Fate Talent, you should choose &9Knowledge Of Runes and Stars &7as it provides &eAstral Power&7.
&eHealers are supports that protect their allies by healing and giving magical temporal shields.
&7Your main focus is &eHoly Power&7, obtained through talents and gear. You can use the &6Holy Book&7 to cast healing spells.
&7You might also focus on a bit of defense, such as maximum health or movement speed to escape from targets, as your damage won't be as high.
&eKeep in mind that a healer's damage is mediocre compared to other builds. Its purpose is to heal, not to deal damage.
&eBards are supports that buff allies with damage, haste, healing and other buffs.
&cYou need to be in a party with your allies to give them buffs! &8(/openpac-parties command)

&7Bards are special, as they don't have a specific gear or stat. The only requirement is to have the &9A Bard's Tale&7 talent fated. They can use specific instruments to give specific buffs as described in the talent itself.

&7The short answer is hybrid. You can mix a Bard with another build or however you'd like. For example, you can be a support with damage by going into Archery gear, or mage, or healer! It's up to you.
&eUnlock Tier II Frost and Healer Guide
&eFrost focuses on dealing moderate damage while providing utility such as slowing down enemies.
&7Besides Frost Power, its main focus is &eSpell Haste&7 to cast as fast as possible. &eCritical Chance and Damage&7 are also good stats, although not a priority.
&eArcane is a high damage element focused on slower but harder spells.
&7It's the Burstiest of all 3. Focuses on &eCritical Damage&7 to maximize damage dealt by critical spells. &eCritical Chance&7 is also important, balancing out both is a good idea.
&7Your next upgrade if you choose to go as a Haste Rogue. The Assassin Set provides +5%% Haste per piece, making it ideal for your build.
&7Physical Damage and Haste nodes should be top priority. For fate, choose &9Shadow Techniques&7 as it increases your Haste by a lot.
&7Your next upgrade is the Ranger Armor, as it provides the highest Ranged Damage, useful for your build.
&7Shortbows or Rapid Crossbows are the best options for DPS due to their low draw speed.
&7Pick all Ranged Damage options and as a Fate, get &9Sin'dorei Heritage
&7Your next upgrade is the Ranger Armor, as it provides the highest Ranged Damage, useful for your build.
&7Longbows or Heavy Crossbows are the best options for Burst due to their high damage. Alternatively you can use a Veiled Crossbow for slightly faster draw speeds.
&7Pick all Ranged Damage options and as a Fate, get &9Sin'dorei Heritage
&eThe next upgrade comes from killing a Mutant Skeleton to get its chestplate.
&7On the weapon side, you can also upgrade your Shortbow/Rapid Crossbow. For the accessories side, get the respective necklace and rings.
&eThe next upgrade is getting a better burst-oriented weapon.
&7You should upgrade to a Crystal Longbow / Ruby Heavy Crossbow. For the accessories side, get the respective necklace and rings.
&7As an upgrade, you can obtain the Prior set, which increases your holy power by a percentage instead of flat, boosting your Staff's Holy Power.
&7On Tier IV, you should obtain the &6Orion &7artifact, as it's the only bow artifact.
&7You can also branch out to three different spellbooks that interact directly with Orion depending on its upgrade tree;
&eFire is a high damage element that doesn't provide utility but provides very high damage with high critical chance focus.

&7As a Fire mage you deal high constant damage but lack of high burst options, to mitiage this you can focus more on &eCritical Damage&7, but your main priority should be &eCritical Chance&7 to have crits as constant as possible.
&7Your next upgrade as a tank is switching from Diamond to Netherite.
&7You can choose &9Righteous Hammers &7for a more dps focus, or &9Bone Armor&7 for pure resistance with a taunt.
&7As for Fate, your main focus should always be &9S'kellak's Blessing&7.
&7Netherite-Diamond will be your preferred upgrade from Netherite so you can upgrade to Sapphire afterwards.
&7If you'd prefer more armor with a bit of health over sapphire's lower armor but higher health, you can craft the &7Warden Armor&7, but it's based on preference.

&7Sapphire Armor is the direct upgrade from Netherite-Diamond, it has less total armor but provides +20 Maximum Health per piece, and a passive that reflects damage dealt to you. This means you take 30%% less damage than with any other Armor from the getgo.
&7Upgrading your Holy Staff is an essential step before moving to your Artifact Weapon.
&7Obtain the &9Ekavar&7 Artifact Weapon and use its Upgrade Tree to evolve it to &eAd'anel, Secret of Ain&7.
&7Now that you've reached enough level to get a Fate Talent, you should choose &9Frost Archmage &7over anything.
&7Now that you've reached enough level to get a Fate Talent, you should choose &9Fire Archmage &7over anything.
&7Now that you've reached enough level to get a Fate Talent, you should choose &9Arcane Archmage &7over anything.
&7The Magus Set is your next upgrade for armor, crafted from Magus' drops, recommended for level 50 onwards, as Magus is a Void's Invasion Chapter II boss.
&7A Mageseeker Hat can be used if you want to proritize critical damage.

&7Many artifacts can be used as Spellblades, as most also grant a spell power of a kind. For fire, you have &6A'zhar&7. For Frost, you have &6Frostmourne&7. For Fire \& Arcane, you have &6Ash'edar&7, and finally, for Astral you have &6Supernova&7.
&eThe final choice for all mages is Ekavar, the Great Cinderstone Staff.
&7The difficulty will depend on the previous Spell Book you chose in Tier III.
&7Your next upgrade for Spellblades are the Runic armor sets, along with alternative spellblade spellbooks.
&eElemental Wizards are proficent in three elements; Fire, Frost and Arcane.
&7Your damage will not be as high as a devoted mage, but you will be very versatile, and later on obtain the means to cast multiple elements at once, known as &dAstral Magic&7.
&eWarriors are melee builds that swing slow but hard.
&7They are the definition of a \"Burst\" class; as although they swing slow their damage will be high, just not as constant as a DPS build.
&eWarriors are melee builds that swing slow but hard.
&7They are the definition of a \"Burst\" class; as although they swing slow their damage will be high, just not as constant as a DPS build.
&7Souldancer becomes your next upgrade after Assassin, as it provides the highest Haste out of any armor set of this tier.
&7An alternative path of the Rogue is a Monk, which uses Fist weapons. You can get a Fist of Fury for those builds.
&eDeath Knights are warriors who fell into Death's Call.
&7They can be high attack speed DPS focused (Frost), or Burst and AoE focused (Unholy).
&7Their main weapon are Runeblades, as they provide all three Death Knight powers.
&7The third Death Knight type is Blood. It's a tank class, that's why it's not included in this path. If you're interested in it, go towards the Protector's Path instead.
&eUnholy Death Knights are a Burst and AoE focused class.
&7Your preferred weapons are two handed Great Runeblades. For armor, choose the Plaguebringer set, which you will keep on future tiers.
&eFrost Death Knights are DPS builds that deal a mix of physical and frost damage.
&7Your preferred weapons are one handed Runeblades, and the Frozen Chamption armor set, which you will keep for future tiers.
&7For armor, upgrade it to the netherite tier, as they'll be the best for damage and protection.
&6Frostmourne&7 is made for Death Knights, making it the best choice for any Death Knight build.
&eBlood Death Knights have less protection, but high health and self-sustain.
&7This is an alternative route to going full protection, and instead focusing on sustaining yourself using the Tome of Vampiric Knowledge.
&7For artifact choice, you have &6Fury of a Thousand Fists&7 for monk builds, or &6Ash'edar&7 for swordman builds. A dagger artifact is coming in the future.
&eArtifact Option: &6Fury of a Thousand Fists &e(Monk's Way)
&eTitan's Shroud &7is your preferred armor because it has the highest &6Physical Damage &7stat, which is your main priority.
&7For an artifact choice, &6Thunderwrath&7 is the best as it interacts directly with the &9Warrior's Devotion&7 fate.
&7You can also make &eHero's Armor&7 as an alternative, as it provides &eLightning Power&7, which depending on your Thunderwrath upgrade it could be useful to you.
&eEnough Knowledge to understand all Tier IV Builds. Good job.
&eHint:&7 You masterized the builds, but what about your artifacts? Try doing some Mythical Challenges with them.

prom2.elhasturian_era.quests0.descriptio: &cFinish all chapters of Void's Invasion to unlock this expansion's story line.
&cTermina todos los capitulos de Void's Invasion para desbloquear la campaÃ±a de esta expansiÃ³n.

prom2.elhasturian_era.quests0.title: &eThe Hasturian Era
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests1.descriptio: &7&oEons ago, S'kellak fought against the eldritch beings, defeating and imprisoning the primordial being C'thulhu.

&7&oWhile its followers escaped, the chains imprisoning its half-brother, a tall hooded monster with tentacles, were broken free. S'kellak couldn't stop his escape, and for eons he never saw him again.
&7&oUntil now, after the attempt at domination from the remaining forces of the void, all realms lie the weakest they've been.
&e&oThe King in Yellow is back, and won't stop until all realms succumb to his new reign.
&7&oHace eones, S'kellak luchÃ³ contra los seres ancestrales, derrotando y encarcelando al ser primordial C'thulhu.

&7&oMientras sus seguidores escapaban, las cadenas que aprisionaban a su medio hermano, un monstruo alto encapuchado con tentÃ¡culos, se rompieron. S'kellak no pudo detener su escape, y durante eones no lo volviÃ³ a ver.
&7&oHasta que despuÃ©s del intento de dominaciÃ³n de las fuerzas restantes del vacÃ­o, todos los reinos se hallan en su punto mÃ¡s dÃ©bil.
&e&oEl Rey de Amarillo ha vuelto, y no se detendrÃ¡ hasta que todos los reinos sucumban a su nuevo reinado.
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests1.subtitle: &8[Click to Read Lore]
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests1.title: &6&lChapter I: &e&lThe Shadow Beneath the Horizon
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests2.descriptio: &7&oI have confirmed that it's him, the primordial being of all unholy things, known as Hastur.
&7&oThe Overworld is not safe, Hastur is great at twisting the minds of others, I will need you to come to Vaaz as soon as you can, before one of his twisted slaves come after you.
&7&oUse this beacon in the overworld, and I'll bring you to Vaaz.
&7&oAlso enchant your weapon with Smite, Hastur's followers are undead. You should be prepared for the worst.\"
&7&oHe confirmado que es Ã©l, el ser primordial de todas las cosas profanas, conocido como Hastur.

&7&oEl Overworld no estÃ¡ a salvo, Hastur es experto en retorcer las mentes de los seres. Necesito que vengas a Vaaz tan pronto como puedas, antes de que uno de sus esclavos retorcidos venga tras de ti.
&7&oUsa este faro en el Overworld, y te traerÃ© a Vaaz.
&7&oTambiÃ©n encanta tu arma con Castigo, los seguidores de Hastur son no-muertos. Debes estar preparado para lo peor.\"
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests2.subtitle: &8[Click to Read Missive]
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests2.title: &eMissive from S'kellak
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests3.descriptio: &7The once archmage and leader of the Hex, dead in the hands of the Champions of Vaaz, was been resurrected by Hastur himself.
&7Now part of the cult and infused with Hastur's power, he has been chosen to sabotage the plans of S'kellak. Kidnapping and killing anyone who tries to travel to the Cinderstone Depths.
&eUse Smite to shred his barrier if you don't have the required spell power!
&7El pasado archimago y lÃ­der de los Hex, muerto a manos de los Campeones de Vaaz, ha sido resucitado por el mismÃ­simo Hastur.

&7Ahora, como parte del culto e infundido con el poder de Hastur, ha sido elegido para sabotear los planes de S'kellak. Secuestrando y matando a cualquiera que intente viajar a las Profundidades de Piedraceniza.
&eUsa Castigo para romper su barrera si no tienes el poder de hechizo requerido!
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests3.subtitle: &8[Click to read lore and indications]
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests3.title: &fï  &6Gu'mas, The Fallen Archmage
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests4.descriptio: &7Signal this beacon in the overworld to travel to Vaaz and meet S'kellak.
&7Llama este faro en el Overworld para viajar a Vaaz y encontrarte con S'kellak.

prom2.elhasturian_era.quests5.descriptio: &7&oCorruption Infusions can be used to add corruption to Armor Pieces, which are useful for corruption scaled abilities.
&7&oActive Abilities from the Talent Tree have special effects and scaling with Corruption.
&7The Corruption Infusion Template can be found as loot in end cities.
&eUse in a Smithing Table along with the desired item and a material.
&7&oLas Infusiones de CorrupciÃ³n pueden ser usadas para aÃ±adir corrupciÃ³n a piezas de Armadura, lo cual es Ãºtil para habilidades que escalan con la corrupciÃ³n.
&7&oLas Habilidades Activas del Ãrbol de Talentos tienen efectos especiales y escalan con la CorrupciÃ³n.
&7El Molde de InfusiÃ³n de CorrupciÃ³n se puede encontrar como botÃ­n en las ciudades del End.
&eUsa en una Mesa de HerrerÃ­a junto con el arma o armadura, y un material.
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests5.subtitle: &8[Click to read indications]
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests5.title: &ePath to Corruption: Infusions
prom2.elhasturian_era.quests6.descriptio: &7&oEtyr Infusions can be used to add Corruption Resistance to armor pieces, that counteract with your amount of corruption.
&7&oWhile abilities scale with Corruption, negative effects are based on your &nTotal Corruption&r&7&o, which accounts for your Etyr.
&7The Etyr Infusion Template can be found as loot in end cities.
&eUse in a Smithing Table along with the desired item and a material.
&7&oLas Infusiones de Etyr pueden ser usadas para aÃ±adir Resistencia a la CorrupciÃ³n a las piezas de armadura, contrarrestando tu cantidad de corrupciÃ³n.
&7&oMientras que las habilidades escalan con la CorrupciÃ³n, los efectos negativos se basan en tu &nCorrupciÃ³n Total&r&7&o, que tiene en cuenta tu Etyr.
&7El Molde de InfusiÃ³n de Etyr se puede encontrar como botÃ­n en las ciudades del End.
&eUsa en una Mesa de HerrerÃ­a junto con la armadura y un material.

prom2.elhasturian_era.quests7.descriptio: &7The Beacon of Hope is broken, now, with no way to communicate with S'kellak, you will need to find a way to travel to Vaaz by yourself.
&eThis questline is coming on v4.0, along with the Cinderstone Depths dimension and the Kingdom of Vaaz!
&6Stay tuned! In the meantime, drink away your sorrows.

prom2.gadgets.quests5.subtitle: Single-block Generator for Basalt!
prom2.gadgets.quests10.subtitle: This quest line is about discovering the unique and quirky items/blocks in Prominence, which could even help with some of the tech mods!
prom2.gadgets.quests10.tasks0.title: Welcome!
prom2.gadgets.quests11.subtitle: Blank Plates are the basis towards Effect Plates. Stepping on an Effect Plate will give you the designated effect.
prom2.gadgets.quests18.subtitle: Mob Filters are blocks that only a select few entities can go through.
prom2.gadgets.quests19.subtitle: Copper pans are an earlygame alternative to ore farms commonly found in tech mods like Create. When putting sand/gravel underneath and water above, they will rarely generate ore nuggets, gravel, emeralds, and a few other miscellaneous items.
prom2.gadgets.quests20.subtitle: Cog Blocks are pretty much just redstone but they can be placed in the air.
prom2.gadgets.title: &eGadgets
prom2.gear_mariums_soulslike_weaponry.qu: These stones can be found below the earth, somewhere in the deepslate layers, they aren't really common though.
These two stones are going to be important into the creation of your soul equipment, remember to harvest a lot.
Lunar Source
Lost Souls are another source of power for these soul equipment and block creation, you can find some by smelting soul sand.
Soul Crafting
Soul Infused Ingots are one of the main ingredients in crafting the soul equipment as they contain the essence of lost souls.
Living Iron
Decorative blocks used in some structures of the great monsters hidden away. Great for a building theme too.
Building Blocks of the Soul

These Silver Bullets will be very important to your soul ranged weaponry as they are the main use for such bullets. Silver Bullets may be cheap but depending on how often you use it, it'll be your debt.
Soul Ammo
The Hunter Pistol is a simple firearm that will use silver bullets but have a fairly quick reload.
Boom! Headshot!
The Hunter Blunderbuss is a shotgun that will use up silver bullets to release a blast of projectiles at the targets.
You Can't Talk to a Human, With a Shotgun in Their Hand..

The Hunter Cannon is a heavy weapon that requires 10 silver bullets to fire as it'll combine all the bullets into one cannonball shot. It has a long reload so you cannot shoot this in rapid succession easily.
Walking Man-O-War

The Gatling Gun is a heavy gun that will take time to load up and start firing at a rapid pace. It'll eat up your bullets quickly so be sure to use this gun only when you have a lot of silver bullets.
Say Hello to my little friend!
Yes, you've read it, it's Big Chungus, gather 9 of these emeralds by killing Chunguses and craft the music disc.
Rabbit Hunting Season
Cheap imitations of what a true soul equipment are, used by fallen fighters such as Remnants.
False Soul Weapons
These tools are so durable, that they even might be stronger than diamond.
Lunar Tools
Such a peculiar compass, they seem to be pointing somewhere far away, where do they point to?
Guiding Moon
Here lies a great champion, unable to find peace and rest. You must kill him and send his body back to the earth.
Find the Champion's Grave
Here stands a king who lost it all, end his false reign and emerge victorious.
A powerful soul of a fallen leader and a heart of a decaying demon. You have freed the king who couldn't die.
Fall of a Kingdom
A powerful soul of a great champion and a powerful essence of a ghost. You have freed the dead and now they have fallen back to the earth to rest.
Exorcism
A powerful soul who was under control of a dark force and a pure moonstone radiating with powerful energy. But couldn't we have done anything else?
Fallen Puppet
You have brought back a fallen knight to their rightful body, and now you faced him in his former glory.
Retribution
A powerful soul of an embodiment of decay, the Wither, and it dropped a shard emanating chaotic energy, what is it for?
The Abyss Stares Back
A powerful soul of the last known dragon in the End. You are now able to harness its power.
Essence of the Dragon
The lunar ring grants the wearer the ability to launch magical waves for a short time, granting the wearer to even shoot from afar with just their hands.
Moonwalker
Making use of the moonstone you found, you decided to see if you are able to create a powerful weapon.
Imitation Moon
After inserting a powerful soul into the swords, they now seem to have awakened with the power of the moon.
It's lacking..
You obtained the knight's personal weapon and chest piece and are now able to call upon the moon's power as your own.
Knight's Inheritance
This sword is interesting, it allows the holder to sense nearby hostiles, may be useful in a raid perhaps?
ALERT!
This weapon is a bit weird, it can transform into a different weapon with a different ability when wanted.
What must compel you to create such an item? To summon a great demon or something evil?
The Smell of Decay is near...
The robes of a dark sorcerer, infused with the power of souls, fairly durable.
Living Robes
You can hear the souls within the armor as they have been infused into the metal, more durable than iron.
Living Armor, but not really
These wandering demons are found in the crimson forests, wandering around as empty husks of killing instinct..
Back in my Day..
A heart of a dying demon, still containing powerful vitality, perhaps we could make use of it?
Can You Feel My Heart Beating?
A condensed form of demon vitality, very disgusting if you think about it.
It All Comes From The Heart
An ingot made of infused demon hearts. It radiates demonic energy, perfect for soul equipment.
Iron Heart
A powerful scythe, crafted by using powerful soul metal to create a weapon that represents death. Summon the dead to do your bidding.
No One Can Stop Death...
Forgotten elite soldiers, can be found wandering around the Soul Sand Valley, but can be summoned to do your bidding.
Long Forgotten...
An equipment solely found by killing Evil Forlorns, put them to rest and be remembered.
One of the Forgotten
A weapon that do true magic damage based on each hit and fire aspect level, but only above a third of the target's health.
It's Time to Purge
A spear with the power of a speeding comet, ready to crash against any target.
Shooting Star
A good bow that can boost a wielder's speed the more their string is pulled in their non-dominant hand.
Escape like the Wind
A simple but effective weapon that gets stronger when night falls.
The Night is My Might
A weapon containing demonic energy. It's sole purpose is to heal the wielder in exchange for blood of their targets.
I'm Thirsty...
A soul weapon that hosts the power of a true demon.
THEN PAY WITH YOUR BLOOD!
An unevolved scythe that is ready to harvest souls, but what souls do you want to harvest?
Even the Scales!
A decimating axe that freezes enemies and makes them explode with chunks of ice upon death.
Freeze the World
A very peculiar staff that forces the wielder to gamble for effects that may or may not be beneficial to the wielder's battles.
Gamble Your Life Away
Thor's Personal Weapon, the hammer is a devastating weapon that can summon lightning.
A decimating mace wielded by a fallen knight, used to summon the souls of fallen soldiers.
Arise, ye tarnished souls
A legendary sword with a mind of its own and can fight for you without holding it.
By Your Will
A scythe evolved from absorbing red souls, and allows the wielder to heal the more they attack mobs when ability is not on cooldown.
Blood Dancer
A scythe evolved from absorbing blue souls, and allows the wielder to have speed and damage during the first few seconds upon combat.
Among the Shadows
A dangerous monster, summoned from the pedestal using the shard, will decay anything it walks on, the Monarch of Chaos. Slay him and receive his personal equipment.
Kill the Monarch of Chaos
The Smell of Decay is Near..
This is where everything starts, with a single soul sand. Are you ready to fight dangerous monsters and earn your own soul equipment?
Everything Starts
Here lies a fallen knight. Free him using a lost soul onto the altar.
Find the Cathedral of Resurrection
Stabbing yourself to stab them more? Not sure if that is a good idea but sure, go ahead, bleed so you can make them bleed.
Whats the cost of a drop of blood?
YOU SHOULD MAKE LIGHTING NOW!!!
prom2.getting_started.quests0.descriptio: &eAs a flameborn, you were created and sent by S'kellak to this place; The Overworld, with an important purpose you must seek answers for.
prom2.getting_started.quests0.subtitle: Click me and read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests0.title: &aFirst Steps
prom2.getting_started.quests1.descriptio: &7The &6questbook&7 is very important in Prominence, and will guide you through most of the game's progression.
&7To easily access the &6questbook&7, you can click the book icon at the top left of your inventory.
&7When you open a quest, the left side shows what tasks you need to do to finish the quest, and the right side shows what rewards you will get.
prom2.getting_started.quests1.subtitle: Click me and read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests1.title: &f&lHow To&r: &aQuesting!
prom2.getting_started.quests2.subtitle: Mine some copper and use the &eBlank Chest Upgrade&r to make a copper upgrade for your &6chests&r!
prom2.getting_started.quests2.title: &e&lUpgrading:&f &fChests
prom2.getting_started.quests3.descriptio: To open the &2Quest Chapters&r screen, close this quest and move your cursor to the left. Each chapter has a different set of quests that fit into that theme.
prom2.getting_started.quests3.subtitle: Click me and read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests3.title: &f&lHow To: &r&aChapters
prom2.getting_started.quests4.subtitle: Craft a &6chest&r - which is later upgradeable.
prom2.getting_started.quests4.title: &f&lHow To&r: &aCraft a Chest
prom2.getting_started.quests5.descriptio: To equip a &9backpack&r, click the Equip icon in the &9backpack&r menu.
Once a &9backpack&r is equipped, you can open it by pressing &bB&r
&9Backpacks&r can be upgraded through several tiers. &9Backpacks&r with special benefits can be found in loot chests.
To see all &9backpack&r variants, search &d@traveler&r in the &eREI&r search bar.
You can find this search bar at the bottom of your inventory.
Clicking on items in the item list to the right of your inventory will show their recipes and uses.
You can also press &bR&r and &bU&r while hovering over any item to see their Recipe and Uses
prom2.getting_started.quests5.subtitle: Click me and read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests5.title: &e&lUpgrading:&f Inventory
prom2.getting_started.quests6.descriptio: To &eclaim a chunk&r, you simply need to right click on top of a chunk, and select &eClaim Selected&r.
Some servers may have lower claim limits than normal. Stay mindful of this limit, so you don't run out.
prom2.getting_started.quests6.subtitle: Click me and read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests6.title: &e&lMultiplayer: &dClaiming
prom2.getting_started.quests7.subtitle: &eContinue your journey through the other Chapters!
prom2.getting_started.quests7.title: &6&lWelcome to Prominence!
prom2.getting_started.quests8.subtitle: The easiest way to teleport between locations is to use &eWaystones&r. Waystones generate naturally in villages and are also craftable.
prom2.getting_started.quests8.title: &f&lThe Basics: &dTeleporting
prom2.getting_started.quests9.descriptio: &7The Talent Tree, along with leveling, is the most important method of player progression in Prominence, as with it you can increase your stats and unlock new abilities.
&7It is directly tied to leveling, as you will receive a talent point every 2 levels.
&7You can open it by pressing &eN&7, to reset it, you can use a &eKnowledge Scroll&7. This item will get consumed on use and your talent points will get refunded.
prom2.getting_started.quests9.subtitle: Click me and read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests9.title: &d&lProgression: &e&lTalents
prom2.getting_started.quests10.descripti: &7All tools will have a random &erarity&7. This will affect their stats. To improve the rarity, you can &ereforge the tools&7 using the second tab in the anvil. You will require &ea tool-specific material&7 and &eone of the 3 ores&7 to successfully change its rarity. &cYou can read the \"Reforging\" tutorial for more info!
prom2.getting_started.quests10.subtitle: Click to read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests10.title: &f&lThe Basics: &e&lRarities \& Reforging
prom2.getting_started.quests11.descripti: &7A core aspect of your player progression is leveling, displayed at the top left of your inventory.
&7It grows with combat experience, such as fighting enemies, or defeating bosses. It allows to scale up enemies to your level, and serves as a progression requirement to fight certain bosses.
&7Each level you get an increase in maximum health.
&eFor some boss fights, it's an essential part to be on their required level! The boss' quest will show on its description the recommended level if they do have one.
&cPlayer Level is a different level than the experience level from your hotbar!
prom2.getting_started.quests11.subtitle: Click me and read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests11.title: &d&lProgression:&6&l Leveling Up
prom2.getting_started.quests12.descripti: &7The maximum level you can reach is tied to your Campaign Progression.
&7If you are stuck at a level and you cannot go up, then you haven't unlocked the next level.
&7Unlocked by defeating the first boss of the &dVoid's Invasion&7 campaign.
prom2.getting_started.quests12.subtitle: Click me and read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests12.title: &d&lProgression:&e&l Level Limits
prom2.getting_started.quests13.descripti: &eYou can find Prominence's Official Wiki at &9https://rpg.prominence.wiki &8(Link isn't clickable)

&7It has over 10 hours of content you can read, ranging more in-depth tutorials, advanced guides, guides to specific mods, lore, useful tips and guides, and more! And the best part is that it's expanding more and more with time!
prom2.getting_started.quests13.subtitle: Click me and read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests13.title: &ePro Tip: &7Check the wiki!
prom2.getting_started.quests14.descripti: &eThe Tutorial questlines are essential information that you must know.
&7Some also say that it's the way of obtaining the Eternal Knowledge.
prom2.getting_started.quests14.subtitle: Click me and read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests14.title: &ePro Tip: &7Do the tutorials!
prom2.getting_started.quests15.descripti: &7To create a party, use the &e/openpac-parties create&7 command.
&7To invite a member, use &e/openpac-parties member invite [Name]&7.
&7And to enable PvP between party members, use &e/opacpvp&7. Keep in mind all players that engage on PvP need to enable it.
prom2.getting_started.quests15.subtitle: Click me and read my description!
prom2.getting_started.quests15.title: &e&lMultiplayer: &dParties
prom2.getting_started.quests16.descripti: IT IS REALLY WORTH READING THE WIKI, FROM FARMS TO TUTORIALS, IT WILL HAVE EVERYTHING YOU WILL NEED TO FINISH THIS PACK!!
prom2.getting_started.title: &eGetting Started
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests0.subt: Welcome to Industrial Revolution, a Tech mod that offers tools, weapons and ways of generating resources.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests1.subt: A turquoise dust with helpful properties for making machines.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests2.subt: An iron ingot enhanced via infusion with Nikolite.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests3.subt: Infusing Nikolite Dust with Diamond Dust seems to enhance its properties.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests4.subt: An ingot sparking with the energy of Enriched Nikolite.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests5.subt: Allows for the upgrading of machines to MK2, this speeds up processing and allows for 2 enhancers to be installed.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests6.subt: Allows for the upgrading of machines to MK3, this speeds up processing and allows for 3 enhancers to be installed.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests7.subt: Allows for the upgrading of machines to MK4, this speeds up processing and allows for 4 enhancers to be installed.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests8.subt:
The Mining Rig Computer allows you to generate ores using rf. 

To set it up you need: 
1. A Mining Rig Computer.
2. 1-8 Mining Rig Drills.
3. 1-8 Drill Heads.
4. An Encoded Ore Data Card.

Note: Higher tier drill heads allow for faster generation of ores.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests13.sub: The screwdriver allows for the configuration of input and output sides of machines as well as the energy cube.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests14.sub: A simple machine that uses LF to smelt items.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests15.sub: Highest tier of the Electric Furnace, allowing for 5 items too be processed at once.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests16.sub: Allows for the pulverization of a multitude of materials.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests17.sub: The highest-tier pulverizer, allowing for 5 items too be processed at once.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests18.sub: The basis of most Industrial Revolution machines.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests19.sub: In order to use an fluid pipe you need a retriever servo or output servo.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests23.sub: A Retriever Servo attempts to pull into the machine its pointing into from all other machines that are connected to the pipes.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests24.sub: A Retriever Servo attempts to pull from machine its pointing into into other machines that are connected to the pipes.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests25.sub: In order to use an item pipe you need a retriever servo or output servo.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests29.sub: Lets you make plates without the use of a hammer, as well as the creation of enhancers to improve the performance of your machines.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests30.sub: Highest tier of the Compressor, allowing for 5 items too be processed at once.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests31.sub: Vital in the creation of higher tier materials as it's the only machine capable of infusing nikolite dust with other materials to enhance its capabilities.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests32.sub: Highest tier of the solid infuser, allowing for 5 items too be processed at once.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests33.sub: A machine allowing for the extraction of more planks per log, as well as sawdust.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests35.sub: Allows for the automatic placing of saplings and chopping of trees. Requires an axe to function.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests36.sub: Allows for the automatic harvesting and planting of crops.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests37.sub: A machine that kills mobs using the supplied sword.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests38.sub: A machine that can automatically breed and kill animals.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests39.sub: Automatically collects any liquid above it.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests40.sub: Allows for the extraction of liquids found in the world.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests41.sub: A basic form of LF storage.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests42.sub: The highest tier energy storage in Industrial Revolution.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests43.sub: Equivalent to a Iron Pickaxe, uses LF instead of durability.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests44.sub: Equivalent to a Stone Pickaxe, uses LF instead of durability.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests45.sub: Equivalent to a Diamond Pickaxe, uses LF instead of durability.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests46.sub: Equivalent to a Netherite Pickaxe, uses LF instead of durability.\n\n This tool also allows for modules to be installed using the Modular Workbench.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests47.sub:
In order to use the Mining Rig Computer you're going to need a encoded ore data card.

This can be created in the Data Card Encoder by supplying 64 of the ore you want to encode and an Ore Data Card. 

You can also increase the richness of the cards by using Enriched Nikolite at 16 per 1%%. Higher Richness levels increase the amount of ores gained per operation.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests48.sub: A machine that allows for automatic fishing. Requires a fishing rod and a water source block adjacent to the machine.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests49.sub: A passive form of power gen, needing only sunlight to function.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests50.sub: An upgrade to the Solar Generator.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests51.sub: The most basic generator, consuming burnable fuels to produce LF.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests52.sub: A generator that allows for the seeds and other plant matter to be used as a means of power generation if first turned into biomass.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests53.sub: The highest LF/t generator in Industrial Revolution. It consumes lava to generate LF.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests54.sub: A small device that reads the energy stored in a machine as well as the potential LF consumption of said machine.\n\nThis can be particularly useful when trying to figure out the LF consumption of machines with enhancers in them.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests55.sub:
Step by step for charging a Core of Modularity: 

1. Place down your capsule with the Laser Emitter(s) facing it with a 3 block gap between it/them and the Capsule. 

2. Place your Core of Modularity (uncharged) in the Capsule.

3. Power the Laser Emitter(s) by routing LF into the back of it/them.

4. Apply a redstone signal to your Laser Emitter(s)

If you want to automate the shutdown of your lasers it may be helpful to know that a comparator outputs a signal when the Capsule is empty or done crafting.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests56.sub: Used to charge cores of modularity.\n\nBe careful to not apply a redstone signal to your laser emitter when the capsule is empty as this will destroy the capsule. Also, applying a redstone signal to the laser emitter when it's not facing a Capsule will result in it exploding after a bit of time.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests57.sub: A Helmet that allows for the installation of modules.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests58.sub: A Chestplate that allows for the installation of modules.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests59.sub: A pair of Leggings that allows for the installation of modules.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests60.sub: A pair of Boots that allows for the installation of modules.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests62.des: &eThis is a meme weapon, please don't use it unironically, it's bad.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests63.sub: Can be found as dungeon loot.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests70.sub: Used for creating plates before making a compressor.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests84.sub: A tool that allows you to rotate blocks and break machines by right-clicking while crouching.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests86.sub: Mainly used to make coolant and processing ores. Can also make wither-proof obsidian.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests93.sub: Increases the LF capacity of a machine by 25k LF per upgrade.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests98.sub: A block that allows you to charge the items in your hand and your armor when standing on it. Connect power to the bottom of the block.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests99.sub: A machine to create biomass for the biomass generator.
prom2.industrial_revolution.quests104.de: &7Industrial Revolution is leaving Prominence. To make this transition smooth, it will happen in phases. First phase will include all of Industrial Revolutions Cables.
&eThey are no longer Craftable and can be turned into Tech Reborns Cables at any time.&r

&7There is many reasons. Industrial Revolution has been abandoned by its developer. The mod is riddled with issues we simply canno fix. The cables do not even transfer at the speed they advertise. Machines break unbreakable items, kill things they shouldn't or outright dont work. It's quality is not something we want in Prominence.
&7Other Features have not yet been affected. This will be a slow process to ensure players can adapt to the changes and move to greener pastures(Tech Reborn) and other Tech mods.
prom2.industrial_revolution.title: &bIndustrial Revolution
prom2.main_story.quests0.description1: &7&oThe Gauntlet, once the vigilant watcher and first herald of the Nether, hath now fallen to the dark embrace of the Void. Slaved upon being one of the Void's heralds, it now threatens its own realm with its destruction.
prom2.main_story.quests0.description2: &7&oThou may find the Gauntlet locked within a monolithic prison. Shatter its eye, and thou shalt unleash the now corrupted beeing.
prom2.main_story.quests0.description3: &eTip: &7This boss has strong hits and may one shot you if playing on Normal or Hard difficulty! Try to dodge or craft defensive potions!
prom2.main_story.quests0.description6: &7&oEl Guantelete, una vez el vigilante y primer heraldo del Nether, ahora ha caÃ­do por el oscuro abrazo del VacÃ­o. Esclavizado como uno de sus heraldos, amenaza con la destrucciÃ³n de su propio reino, el Nether.
prom2.main_story.quests0.description7: &7&oPuedes encontrar el Guantelete encerrado dentro de una prisiÃ³n monolÃ­tica. Rompe su ojo y desatarÃ¡s a la bestia ahora corrompida.
prom2.main_story.quests0.description8: &eTip: &7Este jefe tiene ataques fuertes que pueden matarte de un golpe si juegas en dificultad Normal o DifÃ­cil! Intenta evadir los ataques o haz pociones defensivas.
prom2.main_story.quests0.subtitle: &8[Click to read lore and indications]
prom2.main_story.quests0.tasks0.title: Kill the Nether Gauntlet
prom2.main_story.quests0.title: &fï€• &cGauntlet, First Herald of the Nether
prom2.main_story.quests1.description2: &7&oThe long deceased souls of all the kings of the Kingdom of Ly'rell hath been resurrected and corrupted by the Void, now known as a single monster called the Night Lich.
prom2.main_story.quests1.description3: &7&oThe Night Lich dwelleth upon the surface of the Overworld. Seek him in the colder biomes, within the remnants of a broken tower.
prom2.main_story.quests1.description4: &7&oTo find this structure, use Souls Stars, dropped by undead creatures, which shall guide thee to the tower.
prom2.main_story.quests1.description5: &eTip: &7This is a ranged boss, use a flying mount if you are melee, or a bow as secondary weapon!
prom2.main_story.quests1.description9: &7&oLas almas de los antiguos reyes del Reino de Ly'rell, quienes han fallecido hace mucho tiempo, han sido resucitadas y corruptas por el VacÃ­o, formando un gran monstruo ahora conocido como el Liche Nocturno.
prom2.main_story.quests1.description10: &7&oEn los biomas mÃ¡s frÃ­os, en la cima de los restos de una gran torre rota, yacen ellos atrapados.
prom2.main_story.quests1.description11: &7&oPara encontrar esta estructura, usa las Estrellas de Alma, caÃ­das de criaturas no muertas, que te guiarÃ¡n hasta la torre.
prom2.main_story.quests1.description12: &eTip: &7Este jefe es rango, usa una montura voladora si eres melee, o un arco como arma secundaria!
prom2.main_story.quests1.rewards2.title: &eUnlock 11-50 Leveling
prom2.main_story.quests1.subtitle: &8[Click to read lore and indications]
prom2.main_story.quests1.tasks0.title: Obtain and use at least 4 Soul Stars
prom2.main_story.quests1.tasks1.title: &9Defeat The Night Lich
prom2.main_story.quests1.title: &fï€ &9The Night Lich, King of All Kings
prom2.main_story.quests2.description1: &7The Blackstone Golem, the Nether's final Herald, is a formidable creature that can be summoned through its ritual within the Nether.
prom2.main_story.quests2.description2: &7Construct a 9x9 platform of any kind of Blackstone, with Chiseled Polished Blackstone Holders in the middle of each side.
prom2.main_story.quests2.description3: &7Place a shard of gilded blackstone upon each holder to commence the ritual.
prom2.main_story.quests2.description6: &7El GÃ³lem de Piedra Negra, el Ãºltimo Heraldo del Nether, es un formidable golem que puede ser invocado a travÃ©s de su propio ritual dentro del Nether.
prom2.main_story.quests2.description7: &7Construye una plataforma de 9x9 utilizando cualquier tipo de Piedra Negra, con soportes de Piedra Negra Pulida Cincelada en el medio de cada lado.
prom2.main_story.quests2.description8: &7Coloca un fragmento de piedra negra dorada sobre cada soporte para comenzar el ritual.
prom2.main_story.quests2.subtitle: &8[Click to read lore and indications]
prom2.main_story.quests2.tasks0.title: Kill the Blackstone Golem
prom2.main_story.quests2.title: &fï€¥ &cThe Blackstone Golem
prom2.main_story.quests3.description1: &7The Old Champion's Remains can be found in its grave, hidden underground at the Overworld. This skeleton-like figure, who was once a great champion, now has been possessed by another being.
prom2.main_story.quests3.description2: &8His attacks revolve around if he is guarded, switching between the shielding stances with the attacks.
prom2.main_story.quests3.description5: &7Los Restos del Viejo CampeÃ³n se encuentran en su tumba, oculta bajo tierra en el Supramundo. Esta figura esquelÃ©tica, que alguna vez fue un gran campeÃ³n, ha sido poseÃ­da por otro ser.
prom2.main_story.quests3.description6: &8Sus ataques giran en torno a si estÃ¡ protegido, alternando entre posturas defensivas y ataques.
prom2.main_story.quests3.subtitle: &8[Click to read lore and indications]
prom2.main_story.quests3.tasks0.title: &7Defeat the Old Champion's Remains
prom2.main_story.quests3.title: &fï€µ &9The Remains of an Old Champion
prom2.main_story.quests4.description1: &7Obsidilith, the living monolith, is the pillar of the void's influence in the End.
prom2.main_story.quests4.description2: &7Located at its own platform, a giant, eldritch structure that can be found floating in the end. To make it appear, use an eye of ender on the top of its platform.
prom2.main_story.quests4.description6: &7Obsidilith, el monolito viviente, es el pilar de la influencia del vacÃ­o en El End.
prom2.main_story.quests4.description7: &7Ubicado en su propia plataforma, una estructura gigantesca y extraÃ±a, que se encuentra flotando en El End. Para invocarlo, usa un ojo de ender en la cima de su plataforma.
prom2.main_story.quests4.subtitle: &8[Click to read lore and indications]
prom2.main_story.quests4.tasks0.title: Kill the &5Obsidilith
prom2.main_story.quests4.title: &fï€ &dPillar of the Void, Obsidilith
prom2.main_story.quests5.description1: &7The raw essence of the end; the \"Ender Eye\", has been corrupted by the void's presence, turned into a horrific creature. It now needs to be saved from the void's influence to establish balance in the now desolated dimension.
prom2.main_story.quests5.description2: &7The Eye can only be summoned at an Eye Shrine. The Shrine is built with a base of a 5Ã—5 obsidian platform and a 3Ã—3 centered crying obsidian layer. On all four corners an end rod has to get placed. The Eye can only get called in The end dimension.
prom2.main_story.quests5.description5: &7La esencia pura del End; el \"Ojo del Ender\", ha sido corrompida por la presencia del vacÃ­o y transformada en una criatura horrorosa. Ahora debe ser salvado de esa maligna influencia para restablecer el equilibrio en la ahora desolada dimensiÃ³n.
prom2.main_story.quests5.description6: &7El Ojo solo puede ser invocado en un Santuario del Ojo. El Santuario se construye sobre una plataforma de obsidiana de 5x5 y una capa central de obsidiana llorosa de 3x3. En cada uno de los cuatro bordes se debe colocar una vara del end. En la cima del santuario, deberÃ¡s tÃº sacrificar el huevo de dragÃ³n. El Ojo solo puede ser invocado en la dimensiÃ³n del End.
prom2.main_story.quests5.subtitle: &8[Click to read lore and indications]
prom2.main_story.quests5.tasks0.title: Kill The Eldritch Eye
prom2.main_story.quests5.title: &fï &dThe Eldritch Eye
prom2.main_story.quests6.description1: &7This giant eye serves as the eternal watcher of the Prison of the Damned, residing within its own Lair deep in the Prison.
prom2.main_story.quests6.description2: &7To challenge it, thou must first obtain a Vine Rune from the Promenade of the Condemned. With this rune, gain access to the Lair and face the eye in battle.
prom2.main_story.quests6.description5: &7Este ojo gigante sirve como el vigilante eterno de la PrisiÃ³n de los Condenados, residiendo en su propia Guarida, a las profundidades de la PrisiÃ³n.
prom2.main_story.quests6.description6: &7Para desafiarlo, primero debes obtener una Runa de Vid, obtenida en Paseo de los Condenados. Con esta runa, accede a su Guarida y enfrÃ©ntate al ojo en batalla.
prom2.main_story.quests6.subtitle: &8[Click to read lore and indications]
prom2.main_story.quests6.tasks0.title: Defeat Conjunctivius
prom2.main_story.quests6.title: &fï€° &9Conjuctivius, Watcher of the Prison
prom2.main_story.quests7.description1: &7&oJean, once a noble and great emerald dragon, hath succumbed to the dark tendrils of the Void. Now corrupted and consumed by the Void's wrath, she dwelleth at the heart of the End, now known as the Ender Dragon.
prom2.main_story.quests7.description2: &7&oShe is no simple feat, for the Void hath bestowed upon her formidable powers, driven by a strong and unquenchable rage known as the Ender.
prom2.main_story.quests7.description3: &7&oTo unlock the ancient portal to the End, thou must seek out twelve of the sixteen unique eyes. These eyes are scattered throughout the vast expanse of the Overworld and the burning depths of the Nether.
prom2.main_story.quests7.description6: &7&oJean, la noble y gran dragona esmeralda, ha sucumbido a las oscuras garras del VacÃ­o. Ahora corrupta y consumida por la ira del mismo, ronda por el corazÃ³n del End, conocida ahora como la Dragona del Ender.
prom2.main_story.quests7.description7: &7&oElla no es un reto sencillo, pues el VacÃ­o le ha otorgado poderes formidables, impulsados por una furia fuerte e insaciable conocida como el Ender.
prom2.main_story.quests7.description8: &7&oPara desbloquear el antiguo portal al End, debes buscar doce de los diecisÃ©is ojos Ãºnicos. Estos ojos estÃ¡n esparcidos a lo largo de la vasta extensiÃ³n del Overworld y las ardientes profundidades del Nether.
prom2.main_story.quests7.subtitle: &8[Click to read lore and indications]
prom2.main_story.quests7.tasks0.title: Kill the Ender Dragon
prom2.main_story.quests7.title: &fï€  &dJean, The Fallen Dragon
prom2.main_story.quests8.description0: &7&oDeep within Vaaz, the primordial volcano from where everything originated, dwells the Living Statue, S'kellak, creator of all things.
prom2.main_story.quests8.description1: &7&oHe upholds the delicate balance across all dimensions and has waged countless battles to stave off the destruction of the realms.
prom2.main_story.quests8.description3: &7&oEn las profundidades de Vaaz, el volcÃ¡n primordial de donde todo se originÃ³, habita la Estatua Viviente, S'kellak, el creador de todo lo que exista.
prom2.main_story.quests8.description4: &7&oÃ‰l mantiene el delicado equilibrio a lo largo de todas las dimensiones y ha luchado incontables batallas para evitar la destrucciÃ³n de los reinos.
prom2.main_story.quests8.subtitle: &8[Click to read lore piece]
prom2.main_story.quests8.tasks0.title: Continue
prom2.main_story.quests8.title: &eThe Beginning of Creation
prom2.main_story.quests9.description0: &o&7Yet now, after eons have passed, S'kellak lays weaker than ever before. A dire shadow blooms, an eldritch force known as The Void.
prom2.main_story.quests9.description1: &o&7For ages, S'kellak has contained The Void, but with his strength now dwindling, the shadow surges, plotting to breach and destroy all realms. What once were serene beings shall be twisted into deadly aberrations, as corruption spreads its vile tendrils. The time of reckoning draws nigh.
prom2.main_story.quests9.description3: &o&7Y ahora, tras eones, S'kellak yace mÃ¡s dÃ©bil que nunca. Una sombrÃ­a amenaza florece, una fuerza ancestral, conocida como El VacÃ­o.
prom2.main_story.quests9.description4: &o&7Durante eras, S'kellak ha contenido a este, pero con su poca fuerza, la sombra se alza, tramando corromper y destruir todos los reinos. Aquellos que antes eran seres serenos serÃ¡n retorcidos en aberraciones mortales, mientras la corrupciÃ³n extiende sus viles tentÃ¡culos. El tiempo de la destrucciÃ³n se avecina.
prom2.main_story.quests9.subtitle: &8[Click to read lore piece]
prom2.main_story.quests9.tasks0.title: Continue
prom2.main_story.quests9.title: &eThe Shadow's Surge
prom2.main_story.quests10.description0: &o&7S'kellak hath discovered a source of unbalance within the realms. All dimensions now bear the taint of the void's horrid presence.
prom2.main_story.quests10.description1: &o&7Once serene creatures have been twisted into powerful aberrations by its corrupting touch. The fate of the realms rests upon thee.
prom2.main_story.quests10.description3: &o&7S'kellak descubriÃ³ una fuente de desequilibrio en los reinos. Todas las dimensiones ahora llevan la mancha de la horrenda presencia del VacÃ­o.
prom2.main_story.quests10.description4: &o&7Las criaturas que antes eran serenas han sido retorcidas en poderosas aberraciones por su toque corruptor. El destino de los reinos descansa sobre ti.
prom2.main_story.quests10.subtitle: &8[Click to read more]
prom2.main_story.quests10.tasks0.title: Continue
prom2.main_story.quests10.title: &6&lChapter I: &eThe Void's Invasion
prom2.main_story.quests11.description0: &7&oWith the defeat of the dimensional threats and the restoration of the realms's balance, S'kellak, The Eternal Flame, spoke directly to the champion.
prom2.main_story.quests11.description1: &6\"In recognition of your valor and dedication,\"&r &7&oS'kellak's voice resonated,&r &6\"I bestow upon you a fragment of my essence, the Molten Core.\"
prom2.main_story.quests11.description2: &7This gift, illuminated by S'kellak's power, signifies both the hero's triumph and a pledge of continued protection for the realms.
prom2.main_story.quests11.description4: &7&oCon la derrota de las amenazas, y la restauraciÃ³n del equilibrio de los reinos, S'kellak, El Fuego Eterno, hablÃ³ directamente al campeÃ³n.
prom2.main_story.quests11.description5: &6\"En reconocimiento a tu valor y dedicaciÃ³n,\"&r &7&oLa voz de S'kellak resonÃ³,&r &6\"te otorgo un fragmento de mi esencia, el NÃºcleo Fundido.\"
prom2.main_story.quests11.description6: &7Este regalo, iluminado por el gran poder de S'kellak, simboliza tanto el triunfo del hÃ©roe como una promesa de protecciÃ³n continua de los reinos.

prom2.main_story.quests13.description1: &6\"We must prepare for what lies ahead â€” a new form of magic that we're unfamiliar with, known as the corruption. I'll go on a quest to discover a new material that could offer us a fighting chance against it.
prom2.main_story.quests13.description2: &6As for you, that molten core is nothing but a vessel. You will need the essences of ancient beings. Once harnessed, these essences will empower it to be able to forge the formidable artifacts. It is your mission to obtain them.\" &e&oS'kellak explained.
prom2.main_story.quests13.description4: &eLa invasiÃ³n ha sido detenida, por ahora.&r
prom2.main_story.quests13.description5: &6\"Debemos prepararnos para lo que se avecina â€” una nueva forma de magia que desconocemos, conocida como la corrupciÃ³n. IrÃ© en busca de un nuevo material que podrÃ­a darnos una oportunidad contra ella.
prom2.main_story.quests13.description6: &6En cuanto a ti, ese NÃºcleo Fundido no es mÃ¡s que un recipiente. NecesitarÃ¡s las esencias de seres antiguos. Una vez dominadas, estas esencias lo empoderarÃ¡n para forjar armas de artefacto. Tu misiÃ³n es obtenerlas.\" &e&oexplicÃ³ S'kellak.

This will require some work because no Novice is worthy to summon a Great Demon on their first Ritual, progress through the Book of Shadows to become a worthy summoner!

This will result in the summoning of the Fallen Icon, a fierce empowered version of the Returning Knight with a fast and dangerous second phase. When summoned, it will affect anyone nearby with Weakness, Nausea, and Slowness.

Esto resultarÃ¡ en la invocaciÃ³n del Ãcono CaÃ­do, una versiÃ³n feroz y mÃ¡s fuerte del Antiguo CampeÃ³n, con una segunda fase rÃ¡pida y peligrosa. Al ser invocado, darÃ¡ Debilidad, NÃ¡useas y Lentitud a quienes estÃ©n cerca.

prom2.main_story.quests17.description0: &7The primitive seed of creation, the &9Primordial Abyss&7 has the most influence by the cosmic horrors. It is a corrupted land with its own corrupted kind of life, known as the &9aberrations&7.
prom2.main_story.quests17.description2: &7La semilla primitiva de la creaciÃ³n, el &9Abismo Primordial&7, tiene la mayor influencia de los horrores cÃ³smicos. Es una tierra corrompida con su propia forma de vida corrupta, conocidas como las &9aberraciones&7.

prom2.main_story.quests18.description0: &7The hasturian wastes are a desolated land full of spikes that are known as the &eSpire Spikes&7. Some of these spikes have an unknown metal blessed by Hastur. It could be the best way to fight against corruption.

prom2.main_story.quests20.description0: &eThe Aberrations.&7 They are horrific creatures that live in the Primordial Abyss. Be careful with them, when they hit you, they will apply &9corruption&7 to you, which is stackable. You don't want them to hit you multiple times.
prom2.main_story.quests20.description2: &eLas Aberraciones.&7 Son criaturas horribles que habitan en el Abismo Primordial. Ten cuidado con ellas, cuando te golpean, te aplican &9corrupciÃ³n&7, la cual es acumulable. No querrÃ¡s que te golpeen varias veces.

prom2.main_story.quests21.description0: &7The metal from the Spire Spikes, &2Etyr&7, has an unique attribute, it is &2resistant to corruption&7. We could use this metal to prevent the cosmic horrors from corrupting the end.
prom2.main_story.quests21.description2: &7El metal de los Picos de Agujas, &2Etyr&7, tiene una propiedad Ãºnica: es &2resistente a la corrupciÃ³n&7. PodrÃ­amos usar este metal para evitar que los horrores cÃ³smicos corrompan el End.

prom2.main_story.quests24.description0: &6\"It is waiting for you. Bring that pedestal to the End and place two of the end's essences you have found there, an ender pearl and a end crystal. Be prepared, and don't forget to trap it. You have my blessing, child.\" &e&oS'kellak said
prom2.main_story.quests24.description2: &6\"Te estÃ¡ esperando. Lleva ese pedestal al End y coloca dos esencias del End, una perla de ender y un cristal del End. PrepÃ¡rate, y no olvides atraparlo. Tienes mi bendiciÃ³n, mi joven.\" &e&oDijo S'kellak.

prom2.main_story.quests25.description1: &7Deep inside the end's rift, a human sized being can be seen casting an unknown spell. Your ritual will be able to interrupt it, and force it to come at you.
prom2.main_story.quests25.description2: &7Null is a powerful and agile boss, it will teleport every time you hit him, and will spawn minions to attack you. Make sure to never stop attacking it, or else it'll heal.
prom2.main_story.quests25.description5: &7En lo profundo de la grieta del End, se puede ver una figura del tamaÃ±o de un humano lanzando un hechizo desconocido. Tu ritual podrÃ¡ interrumpirlo y obligarlo a enfrentarte.
prom2.main_story.quests25.description6: &7Null es un jefe poderoso y Ã¡gil; se teletransportarÃ¡ cada vez que lo golpees y convocarÃ¡ esbirros para atacarte. AsegÃºrate de no dejar de atacarlo, o de lo contrario se curarÃ¡.

prom2.main_story.quests26.description0: &6\"This is not over yet. That was nothing but a shadow, and now with this rift, I'm afraid we won't be able to do this.
prom2.main_story.quests26.description1: &r&6Unless... we use their own power against them. We could trap one of the heralds of the void inside a vessel, and with it, gather their power. But first, make yourself a better weapon, I'll make the vessel.\"&e&o S'kellak said.
prom2.main_story.quests26.description2: &eFollow the &cS'kellak's Forge&e questline for more information on forging artifact weapons.
prom2.main_story.quests26.description4: &6\"Esto aÃºn no ha terminado. Eso no era mÃ¡s que una sombra, y ahora, con esta grieta, temo que no podramos hacerlo.
prom2.main_story.quests26.description5: &r&6A menos que... usemos su propio poder contra ellos. PodrÃ­amos atrapar a uno de los heraldos del vacÃ­o dentro de un recipiente, y con Ã©l, obtener su poder. Pero primero, fabrÃ­cate una mejor arma, yo harÃ© el recipiente.\"&e&o dijo S'kellak.
prom2.main_story.quests26.description6: &eSigue la lÃ­nea de misiones de la &cS'kellak's Forge&e para mÃ¡s informaciÃ³n sobre la creaciÃ³n de armas artefacto.

prom2.main_story.quests27.description4: &6\"El Ignoto estÃ¡ aquÃ­, otro de los heraldos del vacÃ­o, y el origen de la corrupciÃ³n\" &e&oDijo S'kellak.

prom2.main_story.quests28.description1: &dMythic Challenges&7 are endgame encounters unlocked after beating Null. They are void-infused nightmares created by the now unleashed Faceless being.
prom2.main_story.quests28.description2: &7Each successful fight will grant you a new hourglass with a higher level. The higher the level, the stronger the nightmare is.
prom2.main_story.quests28.description3: &cDying against a mythic boss will fail the challenge, and summon a new lower level hourglass.
prom2.main_story.quests28.description4: &7You can summon them with a &dVoid Hourglass&7. If you misplaced your hourglass, you can get a new one from Null, but its level will be 1.
prom2.main_story.quests28.description7: &dLos DesafÃ­os MÃ­ticos&7 son encuentros de final de juego que se desbloquean tras derrotar a Null. Son pesadillas infundidas con el vacÃ­o, creadas por el ser Ignoto que ha sido liberado.
prom2.main_story.quests28.description8: &7Cada combate exitoso te otorgarÃ¡ un nuevo reloj de arena con un nivel superior. Cuanto mayor sea el nivel, mÃ¡s fuerte serÃ¡ la pesadilla.

prom2.main_story.quests28.description10: &7Puedes invocarlos con un &dReloj de Arena del VacÃ­o&7. Si perdiste tu reloj de arena, puedes obtener uno nuevo de Null, pero su nivel serÃ¡ 1.

prom2.main_story.quests29.description1: &7At the heart of the void's influence, the Primordial Abyss, you may summon the herald of the void, the gruntling faceless being with its dark ritual, by breaking the heart of an aberration on the middle.
prom2.main_story.quests29.description2: &6\"Beware, just weaken it, and I'll attempt to bring it down to Vaaz to trap it for eternity. The fate of the realms is on you.\" &eS'kellak said
prom2.main_story.quests29.description5: &7En el corazÃ³n de la influencia del vacÃ­o, el Abismo Primordial, puedes invocar al heraldo del vacÃ­o, el ser ignoto, con su oscuro ritual, rompiendo el corazÃ³n de una aberraciÃ³n en el centro.
prom2.main_story.quests29.description6: &6\"Ten cuidado, solo debilÃ­talo, y yo intentarÃ© llevarlo a Vaaz para atraparlo por la eternidad. El destino de los reinos estÃ¡ en tus manos.\" &eDijo S'kellak.

prom2.main_story.quests30.description1: &7Magus, the leader of the Hex, is one of the keys for the void to get into the Overworld. He hasn't been corrupted, but he's driven on his own interests and made an accord with the void.
prom2.main_story.quests30.description2: &7He's a powerful mage, its barrier may be weak to certain elements, but the Smite enchant will also help break it.
prom2.main_story.quests30.description3: &eUsing magic or abilities will gather the attention of the Hex. Use a Hexblade on their portal to travel to the Glass Ocean and use a Prismatic Pearl to summon him.
prom2.main_story.quests30.description6: &7Magus, el lÃ­der de los Hex, es una de las claves para que el vacÃ­o llegue al Overworld. No ha sido corrompido, pero estÃ¡ impulsado por sus propios intereses y ha hecho un pacto con el vacÃ­o.
prom2.main_story.quests30.description7: &7Es un poderoso mago, su barrera puede ser dÃ©bil ante ciertos elementos, pero el encantamiento Golpeo tambiÃ©n ayudarÃ¡ a romperla.
prom2.main_story.quests30.description8: &eUsar magia o habilidades va a atraer la atenciÃ³n de los Hex. Usa una Hexblade en su portal para viajar al OcÃ©ano de Cristal, y usa una Perla Prismatica para invocarlo.

prom2.main_story.quests31.description0: &6\"To summon the last herald, you'll have to go through their own dark magic. You should make a weapon born of true corruption, The Dreadtide, to get yourself mad to attract the dark thoughts from the void, the All-Seeing Eyes; we'll need 4 of them for the ritual.

prom2.main_story.quests31.description3: &6\"Para invocar al Ãºltimo heraldo, tendrÃ¡s que utilizar su propia magia oscura. DeberÃ­as forjar un arma nacida de la verdadera corrupciÃ³n, la Dreadtide, para enloquecer y atraer los pensamientos mÃ¡s oscuros del vacÃ­o, los Ojos Omniscientes; necesitaremos 4 de ellos para el ritual.
prom2.main_story.quests31.description4: &6Mientras haces esto, buscarÃ© mÃ¡s conocimiento sobre el ritual. Solo ten cuidado, no caigas en la locura, ya que no hay vuelta atrÃ¡s.\" &e&oDijo S'kellak.

prom2.main_story.quests32.description0: &6\"I have found one of the lost pages of the Necronomicon, this should help you with the ritual. The Necronomicon also states that this ritual has to be done in the Primordial abyss.\" &e&oS'kellak said

prom2.main_story.quests33.description0: &7The Faceless One has been captured and trapped inside Vaaz, S'kellak interrogated it.
prom2.main_story.quests33.description1: &9\"C' mgepmgah, llll h', c'den ephaiagl ot e'enhe, ymg' ahorna mgah ahf''s nog, ymg' ahorna mgah uh'eog ph'nglui turor\" &e&oThe Faceless said, in an unknown tongue

prom2.main_story.quests33.description6: &9\"C' mgepmgah, llll h', c'den ephaiagl ot e'enhe, ymg' ahorna mgah ahf''s nog, ymg' ahorna mgah uh'eog ph'nglui turor\" &e&oDijo el Ignoto, en una lengua desconocida.

prom2.main_story.quests34.description2: &7Found in the Nether, he was cursed by what he thought was his allies. His kingdom was sieged and fell under the lava sea, and the King could only watch helplessly while his mind and body was slowly withering away.
prom2.main_story.quests34.description6: &7Encontrado en el Nether, fue maldecido por quienes pensaba que eran sus aliados. Su reino fue sitiado y cayÃ³ bajo el mar de lava, y el Rey solo pudo observar impotente mientras su mente y cuerpo se desmoronaban lentamente.

prom2.main_story.quests35.description0: &eCampaign bosses have their own level, just like you do as seen at the top of your inventory.
prom2.main_story.quests35.description1: &cThis means that if you are not of a high enough level, you will not deal enough damage to kill them.
prom2.main_story.quests35.description2: &7In total you will deal &c10%% less damage per level difference&7, meaning if you're level 45 and a boss is level 50, you'll deal only 50%% of the total damage you're meant to deal.
