prom2.main_story.title: &d&lVoid's Invasion
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests0.d: Remember, this guidebook is very very important in order to progress in case you're lost on what to do. Please take the time and read them when needed.
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests0.s: Hello, young technician! I am here to help guide you through the factory world of Modern Industrialization. It may be a bit overwhelming at first, but it won't hurt too much, right?
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests1.s: Such a piece of equipment is surely gonna be important for our uses! It feels like we're doing blacksmith work!
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests2.d: Steam machines will accept inputs from any side, be it items, steam or another fluid. You can lock their slots by clicking on the lock in the interface. Locked slots only accept one type of item or fluid.
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests2.s: Full Steam Ahead! You have now made it to this point of learning how tech works, are you ready for more?
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests3.s: This is probably the first machine you will want to build as it saves your hammer from hammering away their durability.
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests4.d: Steam machines need steam to function, and that's exactly what the boiler provides. It will slowly use fuel to heat up. When it's hot enough, it will start to produce steam. Don't forget to feed it with water or your fuel will burn for nothing.
You can also smelt water buckets into steam buckets. Make your first Bronze Compressor before the boiler to save a lot on the plates!

It probably looks expensive to you right now, but don't forget that you can triple ores with the Forge Hammer. Also, as soon as you will have your first two machines, it will become more than twice less expensive!
The boiler will automatically produce and send steam to adjacent machines, up to 8 millibuckets per tick.

Bronze machines can only process recipes up to 2 EU/t, meaning that the recipe will use 2 Energy Units per Tick. As 1 millibucket of steam = 1 EU, a boiler at max temperature can power 4 machines simultaneously!
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests4.s: Oh, That's Hot! Remember that the boiler is an advanced machinery that is able to power several machines at once and saves fuel efficiently. Don't forget to give it water or else the fuel wastes burning to ashes.
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests5.s: The Steam Blast Furnace has a similar structure like the Coke Oven, but this is used to create steel. Perhaps this is where the next stage comes.
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests6.s: The Macerator is an interesting machine that allows the recycling of materials and powder them into dust and be reused again.
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests7.s: This is a miner's trusty item that will mine tunnels in a 3x3 manner. Remember to always refuel with water and coal like a steam engine!
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests7.t: My Drill Will Pierce the Heavens!
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests8.s: The Mixer will help you mix dusts or fluids for a cheaper price. Just don't put your food ingredients in here, or it'll smell bad.
prom2.modern_industrialization.quests9.s: Now this is a perfect machine used to save your materials from being wasted! Use it to cut into any machine part you need, at the cost of some lubricant.
Dust to dust! Clay to bricks! Making these bricks aren't particularly hard, just turn regular bricks into dust, mix it with some clay and smelt.
Where's the Fire in Fire Clay?
The Bronze Furnace is just as slow as a normal furnace, but it uses steam instead of any other fuel source, and cheaper as well.
Coke will be very useful for steel, but it is also a powerful fuel.
I hope that you can find a convenient location for your input and output hatches so it will run smoothly.

The Coke Oven is meant to make coke fuel, not soda. Remember to power this oven with steam using the input hatch and it will give coke in the output hatch. Always carry a wrench in order to see the multiblock structure.
Coke is a useful fuel source that is much more powerful than any fuel source, and it is a small requirment for what is to come.
The Bronze Pump is good at inserting water into your machinery that requires water, especially boilers. Make sure they're near a water source in order for this to work automatically!
Perfect! Now we can move our fluids properly now! Though it only works with one type of fluid at a time.
Steel is the next upgrade to such advanced machinery as it was not only complicated to reach this point, but also shows your ability to think ahead.
&8A Kilogram of Feathers or A Kilogram of Steel?
It's a regular coal's twin sibling, nothing different from each other, but handy at least.
It is time to upgrade your bronze machinery into their steel variants, they have evolved even further than you can imagine.
You Live, You Learn, You Upgrade
The Steam Quarry is a steam multiblock machine that consumes bronze drills, uses them to dig deeper than the bedrock and gives you back some ores, as you can see in REI.
It's recommended that you have multiple SBFs running before you attempt to build it because it requires a lot of steel.

Here we are, it is time to assemble a Steam Quarry, an advanced machinery that uses bronze drills to dig for ores. This will be an expensive machinery but it will be one of your greatest investments of all.
Now we're cooking, perhaps there is more to this quarry than just this drill, maybe we can advance even further?
A Steel Wiremill will be useful to create even more sophisticated machinery, but also remember that you need some raw synthetic oil and paper to make rubber sheets and more.
Do not tangle up the wires, okay?
Let's start small first. You never know how this will turn out.
You have done well to make it this far. Now that we have moved on from steam, we are now doing even more complicated machinery using electricity, but the results are rewarding.
Now we can force items to be transported! Remember to force a connection with the pipes into machineries so they will transport them when needed.
The Assembler is a sophisticated machinery that will automate almost all of your machinery parts, but remember to make more of them to make it easier.
I feel like we're creating a Steam Engine with how much bigger these boilers get. Anyway, this is an upgraded version of your already known boilers, they use up more fuel but their output is tremendous.
Can we boil our food now? No?
The Steam Turbine uses steam to produce electricity. But there will be more upgrades to this certain turbine so remember to make a lot of these to power your electrical machinery.
The Polarizer is a unique machinery that adds in magnet like properties to certain machinery parts that will be essential.
The electric version of the Steam Blast Furnace, nothing more, nothing less. But it does add more recipes that can only be done with this furnace.
Oh dear me, this was such a headache, but now we're going even further beyond? I hope I don't get a headache..
Will turn various fluids into their lighter parts. So this is how we get distilled water?
These tools will be powerful and potentially replace your pickaxe and shovel. The jetpack will also fly faster with better fuel, handle with care.
&bIs it a Jet Engine or a Diesel Engine?
A Digital World! Finally, we're at this stage, where things get even more ridiculously complex. Remember to read carefully.
A huge multiblock that can dig for Crude Oil under the bedrock using fluid pipes. I hope we can sell all this oil for money... wait, do we have money at all?
Can make items and fluids react with each other.
This is a very advanced machinery that is fairly tall with how they're able to assemble to an even taller machinery. If you would like to change the height, right click it with a screwdriver and it applies to other multiblocks with multiple shapes like the Kanthal tier Electric Blast Furnace!
You can use a Heat Exchanger to recover the HP water for another cycle.
Turbo Upgrades will be useful to speed up your machinery when right clicked with it while the Advanced Machine Hulls will be used on machines to accept MV only as they're a higher tier. Both can be removed using a crowbar when necessary.
Splits items by spinning them very fast.
Provide it with items and energy, and watch your resources GO BRRR!
Its structure is exactly the same as the Steam Quarry's.
The electric equivalent of the Steam Quarry.
You are almost there! With oil processing, you're a few steps closer to making even more advanced machinery.
I wonder if this steam turbine can blow us away? Nah.
Another option for small setups is to use an HV steam turbine, they are not a joke with their production.
The Vacuum Freezer is what it sounds like, it cools down or freezes solids and liquids in order to make them usable.
I hope it's safe to put ice cream in here.
Can split materials into their different parts using strong electric currents.
Smelting stainless steel dust in an EBF will give you hot ingots, which you can cool back into regular ingots with a Vacuum Freezer.
Stainless Steel, another necessary ingot used for new stuff. Wait.. I see a stain here!
Kanthal Coils are used by the Electric Blast Furnace to produce more materials as they are powerful enough to do so.
This is not an easy metal to work with, remember that you need machinery to even bend this, but it shows its durability.
A Processing Unit is used to create highly sophisticated machine parts and even highly advanced drills that are already difficult to make use of.
This blastproof alloy plate is going to be specially important with a specific process that will be booming.
Can we make a shield out of this?
A new multiblock made of titanium that can turn water into HP (high pressure) water, steam into HP steam, and the other way around.
A specialized chestplate that is used to grant the wearer fall damage protection and creative flight, but will not protect the wearer from any external damage. It must be powered in order to use.
An Implosion Compressor is an interesting machinery that contains explosions inside it. Using Industrial TNT, it is able to compress the most resistant materials.
Using this very delicate material, it will be used to create the best of the best machinery for UNLIMITED POWER!!
The most powerful machine upgrade ever. Have a look at yourself: Was it worth it?
The Fusion Reactor is the ultimate energy source, to make it work requires a large amount of energy and it can combine Deuterium, Tritium, and/ or Helium-3 into Helium Plasma.
Do not underestimate SCIENCE! Without it, we wouldn't have been able to create the best energy producer of the mod!
It can produce 100s of times more EU/t than diesel. It comes in several sizes from small to large.

How it works under the hood can be a bit overwhelming, nevertheless, you don't need to understand the details to be able to design a powerful reactor. We recommend that you experiment with various designs in creative mode until you find one that suits you.

Note that the Nuclear Reactor cannot explode, emit radiation, or otherwise damage the map. The only thing that it can damage is the items you put in it if the temperature gets too high (more on this later). You should feel free to experiment, and enjoy your new life as a nuclear scientist!
The main component is the Nuclear Casing which is made with Nuclear Alloy : a mix of cadmium, beryllium and blastproof alloy.
The upper part of the structure accepts Nuclear Item or Fluid Hatches (or simple casings). Those are the inputs and outputs of the reactor.
Each hatch has one input (either item or fluid) and two outputs. The input slots will form a grid, displayed in the reactor GUI (accessible by right-clicking on the controller).

Each hatch has a temperature and stores heat which can be dissipated in several ways. The heat will naturally move to an adjacent hatch or to the outside if the hatch is on the edge (the heat is then lost). The speed of this process is equal to the hatches content's heat transfer coefficient (shown in REI) times the temperature difference. The heat can also be extracted in a fluid hatch by producing steam. A temperature above an item's maximum temperature will destroy it.

The core nuclear reactor elements are neutrons. Those are produced by the nuclear fuel. There are two type of neutrons, fast and thermal : the fast carry energy while the thermal do not. Neutrons move in a straight line until they encounter an element or exit the reactor (for fast neutrons, their energy is then lost). The flow of neutrons is shown in the reactor GUI.

When a neutron encounters a non-empty hatch, two things can happen : the neutron is absorbed or scattered. A scattered neutron will randomly change direction. If the scattered neutron is fast, it has a chance of slowing down, becoming a thermal one. This transfers the energy from the neutron to the hatch in the form of heat. An absorbed neutron stops its course and also transfers its energy if it was a fast neutron.

The number of absorbed neutrons in a single hatch can be seen in the GUI. The probability for each processes is shown in REI. Those will strongly depend on the hatch's content and the neutron type (fast or thermal). Nuclear fuels absorb thermal neutrons far better.

When a neutron, either fast or thermal, is absorbed in nuclear fuel, more neutrons are generated. Those are always fast neutrons and have random direction. Their generation is accompanied by the direct release of energy in the form of additional heat in the hatch.

Above a certain threshold, the number of generated neutrons will decrease with the temperature until reaching zero. This process wastes some energy, but guarantees the stability of the reactor. The number of generated neutrons (and effective efficiency), the direct energy and the temperature threshold are in REI.

Each nuclear component has maximum number of absorptions. When reached, the item is either destroyed or transformed into a depleted version. This is particularly useful for nuclear fuel because some part of the U238 is transformed into Plutonium in the depleted version, meaning some of it can be transformed back into fuel.

The same thing happens for fluids: a bit of fluid is transformed after each neutron absorption. This can be used to mass produce useful isotopes like deuterium and tritium. In both cases, the outcome is shown in REI.
A large multiblock whose purpose is to generate massive amounts of energy by consuming nuclear fuel.
Nah, it doesn't explode and do external damage, but it only works inside machinery, sorry to burst your bubble.
I wonder if creating a miniature black hole is safe? Ah well, it'll be useful for quantum physics.
Are we gonna fix history for Humanity?
This is a difficult bucket to use. With an electrolyzer and a singularity, large amounts of energy will be turned into Hawnking Radiation, into UU Matter, the very fabric of the universe!!
A specialized drill used to dig for crude oil and only useful in an Oil Drilling Rig.
One of the most expensive drills to create, but it is useful for digging up iridium and uranium ores.
Don't break it with the wrench, use a pickaxe.
Is it a monkey or a wrench? Anyway this will be useful in rotating the machine or changing their input and output locations.
This machine part will be needed in order for more advanced electric machinery to function so remember to make some of these.
Getting these steel hatches will be essential for your quarry to use up their drills and give out their results.
You can now automate double ingots and pipes, for example! Again, check REI.
The Steel Packer is a self-explanatory machinery that automates combining of certain machinery parts, the sibling of Steel Unpacker.
The Steel Unpacker is a self-explanatory machinery that takes apart machine parts into other smaller pieces as a sort of recycling system, and the sibling of the Steel Packer.
Cable networks have limitations on the amount of energy they will pull into the network depending on tier.
My back is killing me! More boilers?! I might get a heatstroke at this rate!
prom2.modern_industrialization.title: &6Modern Industrialization
prom2.powah.quests0.description0: The book will help you understand the mod if needed.
prom2.powah.quests0.subtitle: Welcome to Powah! A generator mod used to power machinery of almost every tech available. Learning how to use them will give you the power to function your machinery without the need to use fuel.
prom2.powah.quests0.tasks0.title: Ready to Power?
prom2.powah.quests0.title: Electrician's First Job
prom2.powah.quests1.subtitle: Dielectric Paste is an ingredient used to glue and craft electric parts used in the machinery, you should prepare a lot if you plan on upgrading.
prom2.powah.quests1.title: Electric Glue
prom2.powah.quests2.subtitle: Dielectric Rods are one of the main building parts in creating another piece of machinery part.
prom2.powah.quests2.title: Initial Parts
prom2.powah.quests3.subtitle: The Wrench is a tool used to rotate powah machinery, config with energy cables and even link certain electric rods to energizing orbs.
prom2.powah.quests3.title: Electrician's Right Hand
prom2.powah.quests4.subtitle: By itself, it's not useful, but after using it on a Zombie or a Husk, it will upgrade into the Player Aerial Pearl.
prom2.powah.quests5.subtitle: Capacitors are the next parts that are used to create a variety of electric machinery, you can either combine two capacitors to get a large one or cut one to get two tiny capacitors.
prom2.powah.quests5.title: Secondary Parts
prom2.powah.quests6.subtitle: Thermo Plates are an essential part used to create and upgrade your generators.
prom2.powah.quests7.subtitle: Dielectric Casing is a material that is required on all machinery to function as they always contain one in each recipe and upgrade.
prom2.powah.quests7.title: Heart of the Machine
prom2.powah.quests8.subtitle: An exclusive ingredient used to create Player Transmitters.
prom2.powah.quests9.subtitle: A Player Transmitter will charge items in the player's inventory or equipped armor/trinkets.
prom2.powah.quests9.title: Walking Battery
prom2.powah.quests10.subtitle: Used to create Binding Cards.
prom2.powah.quests11.subtitle: A Binding Card is used to connect a Player Transmitter to a machinery that can wirelessly connect to each other and charge. Only works in the same dimension.
prom2.powah.quests12.subtitle: This Binding Card will allow wireless charging across dimensions, but must use a binding card on an Enderman to work.
prom2.powah.quests12.title: Bounded Through Dimensions
prom2.powah.quests19.subtitle: Energizing Rods are a type of machinery that energizes items contained in an energizing orb and transforms them.
prom2.powah.quests20.subtitle: As the name implies, Energizing Orb receives electric charge and uses it on items to upgrade machinery. The higher tier the material, the more power required to energize.
prom2.powah.quests32.subtitle: 2nd Tier Capacitors used to upgrade to Hardened Machinery.
prom2.powah.quests33.subtitle: 3rd Tier Capacitors used to upgrade to Blazing Machinery.
prom2.powah.quests34.subtitle: 4th Tier Capacitors used to upgrade to Niotic Machinery.
prom2.powah.quests35.subtitle: 5th Tier Capacitors used to upgrade to Spirited Machinery.
prom2.powah.quests36.subtitle: The 6th Tier Capacitor used to upgrade to Nitro Machinery, the final tier.
prom2.powah.quests37.subtitle: Thermo Generators use heat sources under them to generate power and use water to cool down. The higher tier, the more power generated from heat.
prom2.powah.quests44.subtitle: Furnators use burning fuel sources such as coal and wood to generate power. The higher tier, the more power and efficiency created from fuel sources.
prom2.powah.quests45.subtitle: Energy Hoppers are used to charge items in a chest without the need to use an energizing orb.
prom2.powah.quests46.subtitle: Uraninite is used to create Reactors that also use uraninite to generate electricity. You need 36 blocks to create a functioning Reactor, the higher tier, the more power generated from Uraninite.
prom2.powah.quests48.subtitle: Ender Cores are a primary material used to create ender-based machinery.
prom2.powah.quests49.subtitle: Ender Cells are energy transferring machinery that is wireless and will transfer power through another Ender Cell using the same channel number. Each Ender Cell must contain an Energy Cell in order to function and store power.
prom2.powah.quests63.subtitle: Magmators use lava to generator power. The higher the tier, the more power and efficiency used from lava.
prom2.powah.quests64.subtitle: Dry ice is used to cool down Reactors, another alternative to using water as coolant.
prom2.powah.quests65.subtitle: Energy Dischargers drain energy away from charged machinery and store it in an internal storage pocket and can redirect the power into another piece of machinery using cables.
prom2.powah.quests66.subtitle: Photoelectric Panes are used to create Solar Panels.
prom2.powah.quests67.description0: Use a Photoelectric Pane on an Enderman or Endermite.
prom2.powah.quests67.subtitle: A Lens of Ender allows a Solar Panel to see through blocks which allows it to absorb sunlight while under a block.
prom2.powah.quests68.subtitle: Solar Panels generate energy during the day time, the higher tier, the more power generated during the day.
prom2.powah.quests69.subtitle: Charged Snowballs carry enough energy to cause a lightning strike when hitting a mob or hitting the ground.
prom2.powah.quests70.subtitle: Portable energy storage that can be used to charge machinery when needed.
prom2.powah.quests89.subtitle: Energy Cells are basically a bulk battery that can contain and transfer energy to other machinery connected to it when a machine is taking time to produce energy.
prom2.powah.title: &5Powah!
prom2.reforging.quests0.description0: &7When crafting or obtaining tools, armors or weapons, you will notice that they have a quality.
prom2.reforging.quests0.description8: &6Reforging&7 is an essential part of your own progression because it allows to change the rarity your item has.
prom2.reforging.quests0.description9: &7To do so, you can find the &eReforging&7 tab in an &eAnvil&7. You will require:
prom2.reforging.quests0.description14: &7The base material is related directly to the item you want to reforge. For example, a &eHoly Wand&7 would require a &eGold Ingot&7 as a base material. You can see the required materials by hovering over the reforge button after placing your item in the middle slot.
prom2.reforging.quests0.description16: &7The Base Item is the item you want to change the rarity. Not all items are reforgable, only tools, weapons and armors are.
prom2.reforging.quests0.description18: &7This material will decide what quality your item will be reforged to, there are 3 tiers of materials which you can see in the next quests of this questline.
prom2.reforging.quests0.description20: &7It's not all about grinding! You can &eincrease chances on higher qualities&7 with your &aLuck&7! Items that give luck passively, luck potions, trinkets, wine, get them all!
prom2.reforging.quests0.subtitle: &8[Click to read instructions]
prom2.reforging.quests0.tasks0.title: Craft an Anvil
prom2.reforging.quests0.title: &eWhat is Reforging?
prom2.reforging.quests1.description0: &7The &nLimestone Chunk&r&7 is the first tier of reforging materials.
prom2.reforging.quests1.description1: &7It is found in the &aOverworld&7, obtainable by &eStonecutting&7 a &fLimestone Block&r&8 (for 4 pieces)&7, or an &fDiorite Block&r &8(for 1 piece)
prom2.reforging.quests1.description2: &7It can reforge to the following qualities:
prom2.reforging.quests1.subtitle: &8[Click to read instructions]
prom2.reforging.quests1.title: &6&lTier I: &fLimestone
prom2.reforging.quests2.description0: &7The &nPyrite Chunk&r&7 is the second tier of reforging materials.
prom2.reforging.quests2.description1: &7It is found in the &cNether&7, obtainable by &eCrafting&7 using 4 &6Pyrite Dust&r&8 (for 1 piece)&7, or by &eSmelting&7 an &6Ancient Debris&r&7 block &8(for 4 pieces)
prom2.reforging.quests2.description2: &8* Pyrite Dust can be obtained by mining Pyrite Ore in the Nether
prom2.reforging.quests2.description3: &7It can reforge to the following qualities:
prom2.reforging.quests2.subtitle: &8[Click to read instructions]
prom2.reforging.quests2.title: &6&lTier II: &ePyrite
prom2.reforging.quests3.description0: &7The &nGalena Chunk&r&7 is the third tier and last reforging material.
prom2.reforging.quests3.description1: &7It is found in the &dEnd&7, obtainable by &eCrafting&7 using 2 &3Galena Dust&r&7 and 2 &3Popped Chorus Fruit&r&8 (for 1 piece)&7.
prom2.reforging.quests3.description2: &7Alternatively, instead of using Galena Dust, you can use &3End Stone&r.
prom2.reforging.quests3.description3: &8* Galena Dust can be found in the deep caves of the Overworld.
prom2.reforging.quests3.description4: &7It can reforge to the following qualities:
prom2.reforging.quests3.subtitle: &8[Click to read instructions]
prom2.reforging.quests3.title: &6&lTier III: &3Galena
prom2.reforging.quests4.description0: &eOne hundred Mythic items... You truly have became the master of reforging.
prom2.reforging.quests4.subtitle: &6Eternal Challenge
prom2.reforging.quests4.tasks0.title: &eBecome a Mythic Blacksmith
prom2.reforging.quests4.title: &cMythic Blacksmith
prom2.reforging.quests5.description0: &8You've became a very renowned blacksmith. What are you going to do with this knowledge?
prom2.reforging.quests5.rewards0.title: &dPiece of Eternal Knowledge
prom2.reforging.quests5.subtitle: &8Secret Knowledge
prom2.reforging.quests5.tasks0.title: I've Learnt the Knowledge.
prom2.reforging.quests5.title: &dEternal Knowledge: &eOf Blacksmithing
prom2.reforging.title: &eReforging
prom2.simply_swords.quests0.description0: &6&lSimply Swords&r &7offers over &a&l15&r &7weapons types for the player to utilize.
prom2.simply_swords.quests0.description1: &7It also has the unique featureset of &b&n&lRunic Powers&r, &7which can be given to weapons via &n&bsockets&r!
prom2.simply_swords.quests0.subtitle: One of Many Sockets!
prom2.simply_swords.quests0.tasks0.title: &d&lSimply Swords!
prom2.simply_swords.quests1.description0: &c&lEmpowered Remnants&r &7are created by melting down unique weapons.
prom2.simply_swords.quests1.description1: &7They are used in the creation of &9&lRunefused Gems&r, &7and &6&lNetherfused Gems&r.
prom2.simply_swords.quests1.subtitle: A Pain to Make...
prom2.simply_swords.quests2.description0: &7To make it, combine a &bRunic Tablet&r &7with a &cEmpowered Remnant&r &7in a Smithing Table.
prom2.simply_swords.quests2.description1: &7Click to identify which power you have rolled.
prom2.simply_swords.quests2.subtitle: Made with &klol&r
prom2.simply_swords.quests3.description0: &7In order to make it, combine a &cEmpowered Remnant&r &7with a &6Netherite Ingot&r &7in a Smithing Table.
prom2.simply_swords.quests3.description1: &7Click to identify which power you have rolled.
prom2.simply_swords.quests3.subtitle: Made with Ash.
prom2.simply_swords.quests4.description0: &7This will be the first step in &bdiscovering sockets&r &7and &9runic powers&r!
prom2.simply_swords.quests4.description1: &7These Weapons can be found in a lot of places. With enough luck you might have found one already. Tales tell that the Wither and Jean, the Ender Dragon can have them. Some other strong enemies may also still hold onto one from a previous encounter with a Flameborn.
prom2.simply_swords.quests4.subtitle: Unique Indeed.
prom2.simply_swords.quests4.tasks0.title: Obtain a &6Unique&r Weapon.
prom2.simply_swords.quests5.description0: &7This is quite the Task. Many of these Weapons will be crucial for your upcoming Battles. The Scriptures are very in depth, but you dont recognize all names just yet.
prom2.simply_swords.quests5.description1: You can find these weapons in many ways. After some calculations from the old book you deduct the following Chances:
prom2.simply_swords.quests5.subtitle: Collect the Rest of the Uniques!
prom2.simply_swords.quests5.tasks0.title: Collect Them All!
prom2.simply_swords.quests5.title: &l&bRunic Overload...
prom2.simply_swords.quests6.description0: &7What will you choose? Will you regret your choices?
prom2.simply_swords.quests6.subtitle: Dormant Power Lies Beneath...
prom2.simply_swords.quests7.description0: &7Look at your righteousness.  If only they could see you now.
prom2.simply_swords.quests7.subtitle: All Mighty!
prom2.simply_swords.quests8.description0: &7You were sent to destroy them, not join them!
prom2.simply_swords.quests8.subtitle: Tainted and Twisted.
prom2.simply_swords.quests9.description0: &7Where there is Light, there is Darkness. Are you sure youre up to the Challenge?
prom2.simply_swords.quests9.subtitle: Pure Light.
prom2.simply_swords.quests10.description: &7He is gone. I am what remains.
prom2.simply_swords.quests10.subtitle: Death Awaits.
prom2.simply_swords.quests11.description: &7'Cause Man is a Wolf to another Man
prom2.simply_swords.quests11.subtitle: To slay a Dragon
prom2.simply_swords.quests12.description: &7This blades stares at you with a sense of a Holy purpose. Something greater than it could even comprehend.
prom2.simply_swords.quests12.subtitle: &7It watched a great Paladin slay a Beast. But he who kills cannot be far from a Beast himself.
prom2.simply_swords.quests13.description: &7Two Storms, chained together by a single Handle. You can feel how volatile it is.
prom2.simply_swords.quests13.subtitle: The Storm has no Conscience
prom2.simply_swords.quests14.description: &7Let the Land thunder with my Storm!
prom2.simply_swords.quests14.subtitle: The first River, was a River of Blood.
prom2.simply_swords.quests15.description: &7There is a charm about the forbidden that makes it unspeakably desirable.
prom2.simply_swords.quests15.subtitle: It stings, just holding it. Wonder what that blade will do.
prom2.simply_swords.quests16.description: &7A delicate pair of Eyes, set on this blade, to forever judge the kills you do with it. Who are you to decide about life or death?
prom2.simply_swords.quests16.subtitle: &7They will never stop judging your Actions.
prom2.simply_swords.quests17.description: &7Whoever wielded this, didnt make it long. How will you fare against yourself? The Blades is as disgusting as it is sharp. The Blade's inscription tells that the Title of Plaguelord was bestowed upon the poor soul that accepted it.
prom2.simply_swords.quests17.subtitle: Do you feel Diseased?
prom2.simply_swords.quests18.description: &7Whoever wronged the Wielder shall pay the Price tenfold.
prom2.simply_swords.quests18.subtitle: The Fire on this Blade is fueled by hate like Gasoline.
prom2.simply_swords.quests19.description: &7No Evil thinks it is evil. Noone chooses Evil because it is Evil, they only mistake it for the the good one seeks.
prom2.simply_swords.quests19.subtitle: This Weapon attracts Fury like a Magnet.
prom2.simply_swords.quests20.subtitle: &7If it were stolen, was it ever yours to begin with?
prom2.simply_swords.quests21.description: &7Any Betrayal you can see, is trivial. Whoever killed with this, did it for the sport or their own gain. Once a Straight Blade, this Weapon now mimicks the twisted mind of its Creator.
prom2.simply_swords.quests21.subtitle: With a smug grin, he stabbed what they thought was dear to him.
prom2.simply_swords.quests22.description: &7This blade reeks of a Betrayal that has changed this Weapon forever. A Betrayal so heartbreaking, it cannot even be forgotten by the ones that don't know it. The Souls in this Weapon ooze guilt.
prom2.simply_swords.quests22.subtitle: &7A Blade Lucius would love.
prom2.simply_swords.quests23.subtitle: &7I will rend the Flesh, until i stand as a unholy god.
prom2.simply_swords.quests24.description: &7Like a Magnet for Souls. Loves sewing them together as if they were Fabric.
prom2.simply_swords.quests24.subtitle: &7An agglomeration of Souls
prom2.simply_swords.quests25.description: &7Which one do you dread more, the Echo or the answer. Howl your Melancholic Question.
prom2.simply_swords.quests25.subtitle: Oh tell me Great One
prom2.simply_swords.quests26.description: &7You are mesmerized by the flowing Lava on this Blade. It reminds you of something...
prom2.simply_swords.quests26.subtitle: The Prince
prom2.simply_swords.quests27.description: &7Forged out of the remains of a great cold being, you can feel how it fought its last Battle with every swing.
prom2.simply_swords.quests27.subtitle: He who stares into the Abyss...
prom2.simply_swords.quests28.description: &7There is a Encryption on this Weapon by one of its previous Wielders. You can make out the first two letters. \"Br-\". The handle still oozes with a heat you wouldn't expect from such a oddly cold weapon. While holding it you feel as if someone made a joke a couple hundred times too much.
prom2.simply_swords.quests28.subtitle: Some things are enough said once.
prom2.simply_swords.quests29.description: &7Once bestowed by a great Arcane Mage. This Blade has seen more than most.
prom2.simply_swords.quests29.subtitle: &7You can't lose, you're chosen.
prom2.simply_swords.quests30.description: &7Even the calmest minds, have a Storm brewing in them. But it is up to the mind to learn when to unleash it.
prom2.simply_swords.quests30.subtitle: &7Before the Storm, there is always a certain type of calm.
prom2.simply_swords.quests31.description: &7A sign of intelligence is an awareness of one's own ignorance.
prom2.simply_swords.quests31.subtitle: A Pain unfelt by the Guilty.
prom2.simply_swords.quests32.description: &7You can feel Death when wielding this Weapon. No living or dead creature wants to be near you. You can feel that this Weapon craves something. It wants to wake up.
prom2.simply_swords.quests32.subtitle: A certain feeling of Death.
prom2.simply_swords.quests33.description: &7It has gotten stronger. You can feel that it hasn't reached it's full potential yet. You must keep pushing. Youre far too gone to stop now, right? Cannibalize life.
prom2.simply_swords.quests33.subtitle: It is becoming awake...
prom2.simply_swords.quests34.description: &7The Blade whispers gratitude towards you. Materializing something that will &4be of great use sooner or later&r&7 to you. Long shall be their suffering. Joyous be their pain.
prom2.simply_swords.quests34.subtitle: AT FULL POTENTIAL
prom2.simply_swords.quests35.description: &7The only thing that will always follow you, is your Shadow.
prom2.simply_swords.quests35.subtitle: &7Like a Bee made out of the absence of light.
prom2.simply_swords.quests36.description: &7A Thirst that cannot be satiated is a Thirst that you will die of.
prom2.simply_swords.quests36.subtitle: In the blink of an eye, the easiest war can be lost to Pride.
prom2.simply_swords.quests37.description: &7To become something higher, is the loneliest Achievement of them all.
prom2.simply_swords.quests37.subtitle: A Blade made out of a sharp Fire.
prom2.simply_swords.quests38.description: &7Our hearts are monsters. That's why our ribs are cages.
prom2.simply_swords.quests38.subtitle: Do not ever apologize for the madnesss which made you a Warrior.
prom2.simply_swords.quests39.description: &7It seems that you are not the only one interested in the weapon. You should not make the Hive angry, or at least give them someone else to be angry about.
prom2.simply_swords.quests39.subtitle: You can hear a buzzing coming from the weapon itself.
prom2.simply_swords.quests40.description: &7Is your Ache known to the Gods?
prom2.simply_swords.quests40.subtitle: A Blade not from this world.
prom2.simply_swords.quests41.description: &7You will never be able to escape from your heart. So it's better to listen to what it has to say.
prom2.simply_swords.quests41.subtitle: A burnt Child loves the fire.
prom2.simply_swords.quests42.description: &7Nature knows no Kings and Queens. They all die the same.
prom2.simply_swords.quests42.subtitle: A Storm so destructive - Who could have started it?
prom2.simply_swords.quests43.description: &7A Fire only rises as high as its Fuel lets it to.
prom2.simply_swords.quests43.subtitle: In order to understand, he destroyed himself.
prom2.simply_swords.quests44.description: &7The inscription, in a rusty, bloody paint says:
&4No matter the shift of the knife,&r
prom2.simply_swords.quests44.subtitle: The Death Oath
prom2.simply_swords.quests45.description: &7How much do you have to lose to be new? How much makes you you?
prom2.simply_swords.quests45.subtitle: Once a Noble Weapon, now barely a Relic
prom2.simply_swords.quests46.description: &7To go against what you know is to invent. But will that Reward be high enough?
prom2.simply_swords.quests46.subtitle: Heresy.
prom2.simply_swords.quests47.description: &7A Question never asked, will always be never answered.
prom2.simply_swords.quests47.subtitle: Knowledge is Power.
prom2.simply_swords.quests48.description: &7This Weapon has seen the Rise of the Deep Dark. It gives off a pulse of Joy when it sees its Home.
prom2.simply_swords.quests48.subtitle: A Blade that has been taught hundreds of techniques.
prom2.simply_swords.quests49.description: &7Forever Cursed and Blessed to walk two Realms, one might only pity these poor Souls.
prom2.simply_swords.quests49.subtitle: &7Between two Realms, yet home in none.
prom2.simply_swords.quests50.subtitle: Guilt can consume you from within.
prom2.simply_swords.quests52.description: &7You wear vengeance like armor, but it corrodes from within. You will become what you destroy.
prom2.simply_swords.quests52.subtitle: Wrath is a Sin that corrodes from within.
prom2.simply_swords.quests53.description: &7Some say that the Soul is the most important part. Some say all you are is a mess of Hormones and impulses. What if you are neither and both at the same time?
prom2.simply_swords.quests53.subtitle: It's the Eyes. It's always the Eyes.
prom2.simply_swords.quests54.description: &7Ever so learning. Ever so studying. All these things knew was taught. Their only instinct was to learn.
prom2.simply_swords.quests54.subtitle: &7They werent many. But their Eyes were.
prom2.simply_swords.quests55.description: &7The more you take, the less you'll have. You will starve surrounded by Gold.
prom2.simply_swords.quests55.subtitle: Greed - how insatiable...
prom2.simply_swords.quests56.description: &7The records were well kept, but the nature of these weapons makes everything decay with time. Noone really knows where these came from or who made them, what we know is that when you see someone wield these, they are most likely doomed to fail.
prom2.simply_swords.quests56.subtitle: &7They came flying from a sky we couldnt even percieve.
prom2.simply_swords.quests57.description: &7A Promise broken is a stab in the Heart. A Guarantee broken is a stab in the Brain. A Heart broken is a stab in the Soul.
prom2.simply_swords.quests57.subtitle: To not be forgotten, is to not be forgiven.
prom2.simply_swords.quests58.description: &7Forever is a dangerous word. How can a Mortal offer Eternity?
prom2.simply_swords.quests58.subtitle: Some things dont end with Death.
prom2.simply_swords.quests59.description: &7Guess what? It stabs a bit further than just wielding it. Hope the Stick doesnt break. Disgrace.
prom2.simply_swords.quests59.subtitle: This is literally just a Sword on a stick.
prom2.simply_swords.quests60.subtitle: It wants something from you. Something as molten as itself. Something that gets more but also less.
prom2.simply_swords.quests60.tasks0.titl: The Weapons needs Food. Feed it what it wants.
prom2.simply_swords.quests61.description: &7Do you really want a night without any confirmation that you're not alone? Fine. Have it your way.
prom2.simply_swords.quests61.subtitle: To kill the stars.
prom2.simply_swords.quests62.description: &7Kill what you hold dear. Kill what sees you. Do you see your reflection in your own doing?
prom2.simply_swords.quests62.subtitle: THE EYES, OH GOD NOT THE EYES
prom2.simply_swords.quests63.subtitle: These Items tend to be harder to get, as they require an Runic Tablet and a Netherite weapon. Forge one.
prom2.simply_swords.quests63.title: Runic Gear
prom2.simply_swords.quests64.description: &7This thing will be of some use, best to keep it with you while you explore the World!
prom2.simply_swords.quests64.subtitle: What will it turn into?
prom2.simply_swords.quests65.description: &7Be not scared of the Betrayal you see, but the one you cannot see.
prom2.simply_swords.quests65.subtitle: Through the Heart
prom2.simply_swords.title: &dUnique Weaponry
prom2.tech_reborn.quests0.subtitle: Welcome to Tech Reborn! A tech mod that provides options for power power generation, power storage, bulk item storage, tools and the creation of materials from energy and scrap.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests1.subtitle: Time to get tapping, here is a sapling to help you get started. \n\n By right-clicking the tree tap on the orange spots of a rubber tree you are able to extract sap that can be smelted into rubber.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests2.subtitle: With its enhanced properties, refined iron serves as the foundation for constructing advanced devices and intricate circuits.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests3.subtitle: These are the basic building blocks of early-game Tech Reborn.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests3.title: Basic Components
prom2.tech_reborn.quests4.subtitle: An upgraded version of a furnace that allows it to run off of energy instead of coal.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests5.subtitle: Using two iron furnaces and some refined iron you are able to fashion a primitive alloy smelter allowing for some new materials to be created.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests6.subtitle: An upgraded version of the Iron Alloy Smelter that allows it to run off of energy instead of coal.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests8.subtitle: With its relentless force and precision, this mechanical masterpiece takes raw materials and subjects them to immense pressure. \n\nThis machine will be very handy on your journey through Tech Reborn.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests9.subtitle: A machine that allows for more efficient use of raw resources, particularly useful for all that rubber you'll need.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests10.subtitle: The recycler is the ultimate machine for getting rid of unwanted items, it accepts any item and simply turns it into scrap by using energy.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests11.subtitle: A basic machine that converts ingots into wire, making for more efficient use of the material.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests12.description0: Allows you to smelt 12.5 items per piece of coal
prom2.tech_reborn.quests12.subtitle: This offers a significant upgrade over the traditional furnace, providing the ability for easy automation and more fuel-efficient smelting capabilities.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests15.subtitle: Congratulations, this is where the midgame of Tech reborn begins.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests16.subtitle: By harnessing the power of centrifugal forces the Industrial Centrifuge allows for the extraction of several new resources.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests20.subtitle: Aluminum is a component in a lot of things around you. However the most readily available should be clay and bauxite.\n\n To get aluminum it's recommended to electrolyze &dClay dust&r / &dBauxite dust&r or industrially grind &dBauxite ore&r
prom2.tech_reborn.quests21.subtitle: Iron reinforced with nickel, creating an alloy stronger than the sum of its parts. \n\nCan be used for higher yield crafts of mixed metal ingots or as plates to make some medium tier generators.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests22.subtitle: A simple, elegant mix of gold and silver.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests23.subtitle: A rather useful alloy, mostly for creating mixed alloy ingots.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests24.subtitle: Made in the Industrial Blast Furnace.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests25.subtitle: Unlock the true potential of your machines with the Overclocker Upgrade a remarkable innovation that cuts waiting times by 25%% per upgrade.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests26.subtitle: Remnants of a bygone era, transformers are a thing of the past.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests27.subtitle: A rather humble upgrade that increases the amount of energy your machines can store. Helpful for when having an external energy buffer isn't feasible.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests28.subtitle: Sick and tired of that whining sound your machines make while working? I have just the thing for you, plop a muffler upgrade in your machine and i assure you... \n\n \"It's quieter than a mime trapped in a library during a power outage.\"
prom2.tech_reborn.quests29.subtitle: Well, it worked. But now it wont cool down. We're gonna need a machine for that.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests30.subtitle: Steel and Tungsten are usually not alloyable but perhaps an Industrial Blast Furnace can get hot enough?
prom2.tech_reborn.quests31.subtitle: Seems like vacuum freezing it works, now to turn it into something more usable.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests32.subtitle: The simplest form of energy production, consumes any burnable item and turns it into energy.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests33.subtitle: Generates 16 E/t by consuming lava.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests34.subtitle: Provides energy from the sun, generates between 0 e/t and 3 e/t depending on the time of day.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests35.subtitle: Provides energy from the sun, generates between 4 e/t and 24 e/t depending on the time of day.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests36.subtitle: Provides energy from the sun, generates between 0 e/t and 12 e/t depending on the time of day.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests37.subtitle: Provides energy from the sun, generates between 8 e/t and 48 e/t depending on the time of day.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests38.subtitle: Provides energy from the sun, generates between 32 e/t and 512 e/t depending on the time of day.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests39.subtitle: Generates 20 E/t by consuming either diesel or nitro diesel.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests40.subtitle: Generates 500 E/t by consuming heliumplasma.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests41.subtitle: Generates 10 E/t per side touching water.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests42.subtitle: Generates 15 E/t (x5 E/t during thunderstorms), needs to be placed above y: 64.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests44.subtitle: For the late-game you are going to need a lot of tungsten. One way of obtaining it is by centrifuging lava or endstone dust.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests45.title: Tungsten Ore
prom2.tech_reborn.quests46.subtitle: \"This machine does it for you!\", got too many Scrapboxes for two hands? Well you're in luck, craft it now! The Scrapbox-inator opens any Scrapbox at the low-low cost of 32 E/t.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests47.subtitle: By taking 9 of your newly found scraps you are able to create a scrap box that essentially is a loot box containing random goodies. Finally a good use for all that spare cobble you got laying around.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests47.title: Who said recycling couldn't be fun?
prom2.tech_reborn.quests48.subtitle: Ah, the chemical reactor. It facilitates the combining of a myriad of chemicals, allows for the conversion of rotten flesh into leather and importantly the crafting of &4Synthetic Redstone Crystal&r.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests49.subtitle: Due to the sturdiness of iridium alloy your compressor wont be enough to make plates out of it. Maybe explosions are a must? Controlled ones of course.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests50.subtitle: If you're running low on resources, now might be the time to get an assembling machine as it allows for some alternate crafts for circuits that cut down on costs. \n\nOne specific recipe that might of interest is the &dElytra&r but how are you going to get those End Rods?
prom2.tech_reborn.quests51.subtitle: For all your sawing needs.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests52.subtitle: Absolutely necessary for making cupronickel rings and nichrome heating coils
prom2.tech_reborn.quests53.subtitle: Generates 16 E/t using Methane or Hydrogen.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests54.subtitle: We're in the endgame now!
prom2.tech_reborn.quests55.subtitle: Requiring 30ke and 30 scrap per uu-matter
prom2.tech_reborn.quests56.subtitle: This malleable substance allows you to craft a multitude of materials, to think it was only created using scrap and energy.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests57.subtitle: A chip optimized for energy flow, allowing you to create machines with higher power consumption.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests58.subtitle: An improved energy crystal, allowing for even higher levels of energy storage.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests59.subtitle: Holds significantly more power than your average battery.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests60.subtitle: UNLIMITED POWER! Or well, at least close enough. \n\nUsing a fusion reactor you can create 16ke/t or maybe make some more of that, hard to get, iridium.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests61.subtitle: The highest tier of circuit, a lot of these are needed for lapotron crystals. They're also useful for making the chips cheaper in the assembling machine.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests63.subtitle: By centrifuging lapis you are able to extract lazurite.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests64.subtitle: Made in the Industrial Blast Furnace.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests65.subtitle: An incredibly powerful alloy, only used for the most powerful items.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests66.subtitle: You can obtain platinum dust by using the Industrial grinder to either grind &dIridium ore&r, &dSheldonite ore&r or \n&dHearts of the Sea&r
prom2.tech_reborn.quests67.subtitle: As simple as compressing an ingot.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests68.subtitle: As simple as compressing an ingot.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests69.subtitle: These crystals very suitable for energy storage, but not by themselves, perhaps with some silicon?
prom2.tech_reborn.quests70.subtitle: A plate of silicon serves as a good base for a lot of electronics.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests72.subtitle: Electrolyzed from &dRuby dust&r or &dUvarovite dust&r
prom2.tech_reborn.quests73.subtitle: Made in the Industrial Blast Furnace.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests74.subtitle: Allows for the creation of fluids using uu-matter and energy.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests75.subtitle: Made in the Industrial Blast Furnace.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests76.subtitle: Obtained from either electrolyzing &4Bauxite dust&r or industrially grinding &dHearts of the Sea&r.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests77.subtitle: By electrolyzing crushed flint you were able to extract the silicon from it, perhaps this could be used to enhance your power storage capabilities? \n\n To obtain silicon cells you electrolyze either 8 &dflint dust&r or 16 &dsand&r
prom2.tech_reborn.quests78.subtitle: Obtained through Electrolyzing emerald dust or Ender Peal dust
prom2.tech_reborn.quests80.subtitle: Made in the Industrial Blast Furnace.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests82.subtitle: Can be found in the overworld between y: -64 and y: 0
prom2.tech_reborn.quests82.title: Iridium Ore
prom2.tech_reborn.quests83.subtitle: Since the Iridium ore is so rare you might want to centrifuge some \n&dPlatinum dust&r
prom2.tech_reborn.quests84.subtitle: Finally you have a reliable way of getting nickel. \n\nYou can get it by centrifuging raw gold ore, raw iron ore or raw copper ore.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests85.subtitle: By using Mercury instead of water in your industrial grinder you can significantly increase its yield. \n\nObtained by centrifuging either redstone dust or cinnabar dust
prom2.tech_reborn.quests87.subtitle: By combining a treetrap with a drain you allow yourself to fully automate the collection of sap by simply placing it next to a rubber tree, letting it collect the sap as it appears. It will even deposit its items into an inventory below it.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests88.subtitle: After breaking your machines with your fist for the 13th time, you realize there has to be a better way. \n\nThe wrench allows you to instantly break machines by shift+rightclicking and also allows for rotation by simply right-clicking
prom2.tech_reborn.quests89.subtitle: With a drain you can pull any liquid above it into it, a simple use case for this could be creating infinite water.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests91.subtitle: Generates 262 kE/bolt of lightning. Place iron fences on top of it, attaching more than one will increase the chance that lightning hits the rod.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests92.subtitle: Generates 4 E/t as long as it has a dragon egg on top of it.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests93.tasks0.title: Power Explained
prom2.tech_reborn.quests93.title: Machine configuration
prom2.tech_reborn.quests94.subtitle: In older versions of the mod (minecraft v1.12) machines used to blow up and cables would break if you used a power tier too high for them. This is no longer the case although you will still see the transformers in rei, they are not needed.\n\n TLDR Transformers are only useful for restricting energy flow.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests94.title: Energy tiers
prom2.tech_reborn.quests95.subtitle: &4[CAUTION]&r At the Highest setting this WILL launch you about 250 blocks into the air
prom2.tech_reborn.quests96.subtitle: By centrifuging 8 marble dust you can get yourself a small amount of magnesium dust.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests97.subtitle: Obtained by electrolizing &dClay dust&r.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests98.subtitle: A slight upgrade over a Red Cell Battery
prom2.tech_reborn.quests99.subtitle: A battery that lets you change its energy output rate.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests100.subtitle: \"An enderchest for energy\" - All Interdimensional SUs you place down share the same energy storage. \n\nMeaning you can now transport your power anywhere without those pesky wires.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests101.subtitle: A sizable upgrade to a battery box, allowing for 100x more power storage.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests102.subtitle: By integrating lapotron crystals with your MFE you can store 10x more power in the same space.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests103.subtitle: If you're tired of charging your items one-by-one I have just the thing for you, the chare-o-mat allows for the charging of 6 items at once.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests104.subtitle: Obtained by centrifuging \n&dGlowstone dust&r or &dEndstone dust&r
prom2.tech_reborn.quests105.subtitle: By centrifuging 16 cells of helium you can get helium^3 which can be used in the fusion reactor for power generation.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests106.subtitle: By canning helium cells we get helium coolant cells which can be useful for crafting superconductors and speed upgrades.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests107.subtitle: Useful for canning all the things.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests108.subtitle: This little thing can chare all the items in your inventory
prom2.tech_reborn.quests109.subtitle: Your most basic form of power storage.\n\nKeep in mind that the dot is the output and everything else is input for all power storage blocks in this Tech Reborn.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests110.subtitle: An upgraded version of the Basic Drill.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests111.subtitle: An upgraded version of the Basic Chainsaw.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests112.subtitle: An upgraded version of the Basic Jackhammer.\n\nShift + Right-Click to swap modes.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests113.subtitle: An electric tool to replace your basic pickaxes.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests114.subtitle: An electric tool to replace your basic axes.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests115.subtitle: A tool made specifically to mine through stone-like blocks. \n\nMeaning it doesn't mine ores. Good for making tunnels or clearing spaces.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests116.subtitle: \"Jack of all trades, master of none.\" \n\nThis tool functions as a pickaxe, axe, shovel and sword.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests117.subtitle: After gong through one too many treetaps it might be time to make an electric tool to replace them.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests118.subtitle: A tool for harvesting ores and the like while keeping their shape intact.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests119.subtitle: An upgrade to the Advanced Drill, allowing it to mine in a 3x3 area when activated.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests120.subtitle: An upgrade to the Advanced Chainsaw, allowing it to fell entire trees in one swing.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests121.subtitle: An upgrade to the Advanced Jackhammer, allowing for an even bigger mining area.
prom2.tech_reborn.quests123.subtitle: The ultimate cable
prom2.tech_reborn.quests124.subtitle:
Getting Deuterium is a three step process.

1. Electrolyze 5 Water Cells 
2. Centrifuge 5 Water Cells to get 4 Hydrogen Cells 
3. Centrifuge 4 Hydrogen Cells to get 1 Deuterium Cell
prom2.tech_reborn.quests124.title: Deuterium Cell
prom2.tech_reborn.quests125.subtitle: Tritium is obtained by simply centrifuging 4 Deuterium Cells
prom2.tech_reborn.title: &9Tech Reborn
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests0.subtitle: Welcome, curious adventurer! I suppose I should ask you how you got in here, but no matter, the world of the bees is what you see before you, explore the world and see what Bee culture can you learn.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests0.title: World of Bee and Honey
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests1.subtitle: What's with the air in this place? It will definitely be not good for those who have allergies, this place is full of pollen!
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests1.title: Hive's Air Pollen-tion
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests2.subtitle: Okay, while there's no actual jam that bees made, but at least there are music discs to listen to.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests2.title: Bee Jams
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests3.subtitle: How did the bees come up with the weapons? Their own stingers? Their own honey?
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests3.title: Bee Weaponry
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests4.subtitle: I wonder why is there a compass made of honey? Maybe it leads somewhere important in this large hive... Why's it sticking to my hand?
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests5.subtitle: A maze? This looks very unsafe, I probably shouldn't go in here without any safety first.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests5.title: Cell Maze?
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests12.subtitle: Many bee warriors have fallen and this shrine is to dedicate the fallen warriors, with a stinger spear of one of the most prominent bee warriors to have ever lived.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests12.title: Stinger Spear Shrine
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests13.subtitle: Bees having a subway seems out of place considering how modern this technology is, but at least travel is fun.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests13.title: Subway
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests14.subtitle: Meet up with Her Majesty, the Queen Bee. She is willing to be impartial and trade with you items and maybe even send you some tasks worth doing.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests14.title: Queen Bee's Throne
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests15.subtitle: Congratulations. You have now earn the favor of the Queen Bee! Now you are one of her kin and the bees will no longer attack you, but perhaps there is more to explore.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests15.title: One of Us! One of Us!
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests16.subtitle: What a majestic set of armor worn by the bee warriors. While not very powerful, it is a very nice looking armor.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests16.title: The Bee Armor
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests17.subtitle: A stream of pollination? I'm unsure of the purpose of such a place, but there is plenty of pollen and sugar water to use.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests17.title: Pollinated Stream
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests18.subtitle: I suppose this is a bee's way of living in luxury, a hotel, based around honey! I wonder how much it costs to spend a night inside.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests19.subtitle: Very curious, there's a villager in the hive raising honey slimes? I wonder how they ended up in here. Maybe they made friends with the bees.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests19.title: Slime Ranch
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests20.subtitle: This is getting ridiculous, how are there pirate bees? What are they trying to steal anyway?
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests21.subtitle: Such a massive flower in the hive! It might be normal or small size in the overworld, but I wonder how it'd got so massive.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests21.title: Overgrown Flower
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests22.subtitle: I wonder if this is how bees were first discovered, and brought to the present, frozen in ice like humans.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests22.title: Ice Monolith
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests23.subtitle: Why do bees need a parkour course if they can fly? Well, at least we can try to make it to the top and find something.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests23.title: Candle Parkour
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests24.descriptio: &c(!) You need to be Level 65 to use!

&7The Crystalline flower can be placed on top of Glistering Honey Crystals. With it, you can offer items to make the flower grow. With this growth, you can choose specific enchantments to put inside a book.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests24.subtitle: The Queen Bee must've cared for such gardens as there is a special flower that grants enchanting powers.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests24.title: &eThe Crystalline Flower
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests25.subtitle: Who knew bees can have a house inside of a hive? Well, a little odd that the house is shaped like an actual bee. I hope we're not intruding their space.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests25.title: Bee House?!
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests26.subtitle: Based on the appearance, it seems that bees would fly around these hoops in the past, but now they're just an ancient relic of the past in this hive.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests26.title: Ancient Hoops
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests27.subtitle: So this is how they make music, they also dance too.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests27.title: Dance Floor
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests28.subtitle: A very small hive temple, must've been another place of worship for the bees.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests28.title: Hive Temple
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests29.subtitle: So there's a fountain for honey. I suppose that's another way to show the bees' love for honey.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests29.title: Honey Fountain
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests30.subtitle: Are the bees training themselves to be able to use projectile weapons? They sure are smart.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests30.title: Cannon Range
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests31.subtitle: There's too much honey! How do the bees keep producing more without getting tired? Maybe we should call it Government Honey in the future.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests31.title: Honey Cave Room
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests32.subtitle: A battle cube seems to be some sort of spider dungeon covered in massive webs, maybe this will be helpful among your tasks later.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests32.title: Battle Cubes
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests33.subtitle: Mm.. an ancient shrine? I wonder if this is how the bees worship their Queen..
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests33.title: Ancient Shrine
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests34.subtitle: How is there a large cherry tree in this hive? I'm very curious how this size is scaled in the outside world.
prom2.the_bumblezone.quests34.title: Cherry Veteran Tree
prom2.the_bumblezone.title: &6The Bumblezone

prom2.the_nether.quests5.description0: The Decaying King spawns in the remnants of the Decaying Kingdom in the nether. This cursed monstrosity wields The Darkin Blade, and has many deadly attacks to look out for. Killing it makes it drop the Darkin Blade, a Lord Soul and the Withered Demon Heart.
prom2.the_nether.quests5.subtitle: Spawns in &4The Remnants of The Decaying Kingdom&r.
prom2.the_nether.quests5.tasks0.title: Kill &4The Decaying King
prom2.the_nether.quests6.subtitle: The Soul Reaper spawns in the &bsoul sand valley&r with its mount, The Nightmare.
prom2.the_nether.quests6.tasks0.title: Kill &8The Soul Reaper
prom2.the_nether.quests7.description0: You are playing modded Minecraft, thus, there is &1no need to mine for hours&r in the Nether to get some scraps.
prom2.the_nether.quests7.description1: &4Finding a Nether City.&r These Cities yield blocks of Netherite and a ton of other good gear that can help you on your journey. &eThe City is mostly made out of Quartz and Cinnasite.&r
prom2.the_nether.quests7.description2: &4Finding a Black Spiral in the Nether&r. These have tons of Piglins and tons of valueables. Make sure to dig down into the Towers. The Structure is mostly made of Blackstone and looks like many Towers connected to one another.
prom2.the_nether.quests7.description3: &4Tech.&r If you already wasted your time mining or got Ancient Debris in another way, there is many ways to make more of what you have. You can reach up to a 8 times yield with the right setup.
prom2.the_nether.quests7.description4: Of course, you can always use &9UU Matter&r from Tech Reborn to make an nigh infinite supply of Netherite.
prom2.the_nether.quests7.subtitle: Ancient in nature
prom2.the_nether.quests7.title: Netherite
prom2.the_nether.quests8.description0: &7There is plenty of Bosses you can fight in the Nether, some lesser, some more of a Threat.
prom2.the_nether.quests8.tasks0.title: Bosses
prom2.the_nether.quests8.title: &5Bosses in the Nether
prom2.the_nether.quests9.description0: &7You will need a Platform made out of &4vanilla Blackstone Blocks&r. The Pedestals have to be one out from the 9x9 Platform
prom2.the_nether.quests9.description1: &7The Pedestals have to be &4on the same level&r &7as the rest of the 9x9 Area. A rough Floor plan can be seen here:

prom2.the_nether.quests9.title: &4The Blackstone Golem's Ritual
prom2.the_nether.quests10.title: &5Ores in the Nether
prom2.the_nether.quests11.description0: &ePyrite&r &7is one of the most important Ores in Prominence. You will need Pyrite to reforge your items to a better Tier. Be sure to mine as much as you can.
prom2.the_nether.quests11.subtitle: Essence of the Legendary
prom2.the_nether.quests11.title: Pyrite
prom2.the_nether.quests12.description0: &7Cinnabar is a crucial Component to most Aspiring Engineers and Network Designers.
prom2.the_nether.quests13.subtitle: Ol' Reliable
prom2.the_nether.quests14.description0: &7Though Lapis can be found in the Nether, its Reserves are quite limited, you find out.
prom2.the_nether.quests14.subtitle: Talk about low hanging Fruit
prom2.the_nether.quests14.title: Really?
prom2.the_nether.quests15.description0: &7You know what this is, you know what you use it for.
prom2.the_nether.quests15.title: &3Radioactive? no
prom2.the_nether.quests16.description0: &7You feel like you've seen this Material before, a long time ago, you dont know where it is from or what it does, but you do feel some sort of Nostalgia when touching it. It warms your Meart in an odd way.
prom2.the_nether.quests16.subtitle: Warm to the touch
prom2.the_nether.quests16.title: &4Nether Ruby
prom2.the_nether.quests17.description0: &7Sphalerite is a Ore containing Zinc and Sulfur, great for both, the stench is horrible though.
prom2.the_nether.quests17.subtitle: Does anyone else smell rotten eggs?
prom2.the_nether.quests18.description0: &7This Metal can be used just like Iron, it also has some own special uses.
prom2.the_nether.quests18.title: &6Like Iron, but not quite
prom2.the_nether.quests19.description0: &7This Assortment of Towers holds great Treasures inside for you to loot. Though, its current residents would disagree on who the Owner of that loot is.
prom2.the_nether.quests19.subtitle: Rich in Axes, Rich in Gold
prom2.the_nether.quests19.tasks0.title: Visit a Black Spiral
prom2.the_nether.quests19.title: &4Visit a Black Spiral
prom2.the_nether.quests20.description0: &7These Cities can be found in Lava lakes. The Nether City is one of the most dangerous Dungeons you'll encounter. Stakes are high. There can be Netherite Blocks in the chests and Drawers, be sure to check everything.
prom2.the_nether.quests20.description1: &7The Spawners are also great for a Farm...
prom2.the_nether.quests20.subtitle: The people who lived here did so long ago
prom2.the_nether.quests20.tasks0.title: Visit a Nether City
prom2.the_nether.quests20.title: &4Find a Nether City!
prom2.the_nether.quests21.subtitle: Just like the good old days!
prom2.the_nether.quests21.tasks0.title: Visit a Nether Fortress
prom2.the_nether.quests21.title: Visit a Nether Fortress
prom2.the_nether.quests22.description0: &7Too annoying to barter? Just rob them, not just of their Gold but also of their life!
prom2.the_nether.quests22.subtitle: It's not theft if they arent alive anymore, right?
prom2.the_nether.quests22.tasks0.title: Kill Piglins
prom2.the_nether.quests22.title: Kill Piglins

prom2.the_nether.quests23.title: &4Visit a Bastion Remnant
prom2.the_nether.quests24.description0: &7Kill as many as you can, some of these may have the Gilded Blackstone shards you need.
prom2.the_nether.quests24.tasks0.title: Kill Piglin Brutes
prom2.the_nether.quests24.title: Kill Brutes
prom2.the_nether.quests25.tasks0.title: Kill Wither Skeletons
prom2.the_nether.quests25.title: &2Kill Wither Skeletons
prom2.the_nether.quests26.tasks0.title: Kill Blazes
prom2.the_nether.quests26.title: Thy Flame needs to be extinguished

prom2.the_nether.quests27.tasks0.title: Kill the Nether gauntlet
prom2.the_nether.quests27.title: Kill the &8Nether Gauntlet
prom2.the_nether.quests28.description0: &7To find the Arena, simply explore the Nether near the Lava level.
prom2.the_nether.quests28.tasks0.title: Find the Gauntlet Arena somewhere in the End
prom2.the_nether.quests28.title: &4Find the Gauntlet Arena
prom2.the_nether.quests29.description0: &7The Decaying Kingdom spawns in any Nether Biome. Use a Moonstone Compass to locate him!

prom2.the_nether.quests29.tasks1.title: Use an Moonstone Compass!
prom2.the_nether.quests29.title: Find the &4Decaying Kingdom
prom2.the_nether.quests30.description0: &7Blood Trinkets can be found in Bastion Remnants, these Trinkets are Vital for any Tank or Blood Death Knight and anything inbetween.
prom2.the_nether.quests30.title: &4Blood Trinkets
prom2.the_nether.quests31.description0: &7You've seen them all, thats it, book a better Tour guide next time! There is still much to find and explore!
prom2.the_nether.quests31.subtitle: Why would you go on a Vacation here??
prom2.the_nether.quests31.tasks0.title: Visit all biomes
prom2.the_nether.quests31.title: A very hot Vacation
prom2.the_nether.quests32.tasks0.title: Visit a Ghast hive and kill these wretched things

prom2.the_nether.quests33.title: &4The Citadel
prom2.the_nether.quests34.tasks0.title: Visit a Pyramid in the Nether!
prom2.the_nether.quests34.title: &4Visit a Nether Pyramid
prom2.the_nether.quests35.title: &4Ore Sniffer
prom2.the_nether.quests36.description0: &7These Gems are essential for any Tank Player. They give off an Aura as if it reflects your touch.
prom2.the_nether.quests36.title: &5The Tanks best friend
prom2.the_nether.quests37.description0: &7There is plenty of Structures you can find that are fun to explore and can yield a lot of Resources. Try to find them all!
prom2.the_nether.quests37.title: &5Explore the Nether!
prom2.the_nether.quests38.description0: &7An old Warrior, long past his Peak lays here. Best to not disturb. Or... is it?
prom2.the_nether.quests38.tasks0.title: Visit a Wither Tomb
prom2.the_nether.quests38.title: Something has been buried here
prom2.the_nether.quests39.title: &5Magmators
prom2.the_nether.quests40.subtitle: Have an infinite Lava source in the Nether
prom2.the_nether.quests40.tasks0.title: Tap the Mantle!
prom2.the_nether.quests41.description0: &7To get Lava out of the Nether, you are going to need an entire functioning Quantum Ring in the Nether and in the Overworld.
prom2.the_nether.quests41.description1: &7Hook a Hose Pulley up to a Storage Bus and connect that Storage bus to the Quantum Ring in the Nether. Once everything is properly paired and connected, you can enjoy the spoils of infinite Lava in your own Home! Hope that Heating Bill goes down.
prom2.the_nether.quests41.subtitle: If you're cold, so is the Lava, bring it home with you
prom2.the_nether.quests41.title: &9Getting Lava into the overworld
prom2.the_nether.quests42.description0: &7What do you need this for? Power????
prom2.the_nether.quests42.title: &9MAXIMUM POWER
prom2.the_nether.quests43.subtitle: Why would you ever go here?
prom2.the_nether.quests43.tasks0.title: Visit the Nether Jungle
prom2.the_nether.quests43.title: &3Leave this place
prom2.the_nether.quests44.description0: &7They spit at you, just how Llamas are, weird... maybe some distant Cousin.
prom2.the_nether.quests44.subtitle: Bone Llamas
prom2.the_nether.quests44.tasks0.title: Kill Nagas
prom2.the_nether.title: &cThe Nether
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests0.subtitle: &cHalloween Event
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests0.title: &eI feel something in the air...
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests1.descript: &7To carve a pumpkin, we first need a pumpkin.
&e- Crow's Guide to Destroy the Scarecrows, Page 1
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests1.subtitle: &8[Click to read the Guide Page]
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests1.title: &eGetting ready to Carve (Page 1)
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests2.descript: &7The Scarecrows have been invading the our world for hundreds of years now.
&7We need you to summon their devious leader and defeat him. We have a really nice reward for you if you do so.
&7We will give you our book, it has all we know about the scarecrow and its leader, it should be good enough for you to summon it and free us of their domain.
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests2.rewards0: The Crows' Guide to destroy the scarecrows
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests2.subtitle: &8[Click for more information]
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests2.title: &cBounty: &eLeader of the Scarecrows
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests3.descript: &7Now you have a pumpkin, so let's get your tool, the shears.
&e- Crow's Guide to Destroy the Scarecrows, Page 2
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests3.subtitle: &8[Click to read the Guide Page]
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests3.title: &eThe Tools (Page 2)
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests4.descript: &7After you get your shears, place your pumpkin on the ground and use the shears on it, to carve it, of course.
&e- Crow's Guide to Destroy the Scarecrows, Page 2
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests4.subtitle: &8[Click to read the Guide Page]
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests4.title: &eCarving! (Page 3)
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests5.descript: &7To get a bit more creative with the carvings you will need better tools, those shears can barely cut things properly. You'll need
&7Make a Botanist Workbench, we can use it to re-cut that Jack O' Lantern and get some better designs.
&e- Crow's Guide to Destroy the Scarecrows, Page 6
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests5.subtitle: &8[Click to read the Guide Page]
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests5.title: &eWork Ain't Easy (Page 6)
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests6.descript: &7From what we know so far, these things materialize out of unanimate structures. A different look to the structure means a different scarecrow.

&7We know that their leader has a metal hook on its left arm, because the idiot who built it ran out of wooden fences. Can you believe it?? Anyway, we know how its structure is, but we do not know its face. You will need to get creative with the carving and try all carvings until it works, you know?
&e- Crow's Guide to Destroy the Scarecrows, Page 5
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests6.subtitle: &8[Click to read the Guide Page]
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests6.title: &eWhat We Know (Page 5)
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests7.descript: &7Only way they can bring themselves to life is if they have some light on their pumpkin, so grab a torch and combine it with your carved pumpkin to make a \"jack o' lantern\".
&e- Crow's Guide to Destroy the Scarecrows, Page 5
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests7.subtitle: &8[Click to read the Guide Page]
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests7.title: &eLights up! (Page 4)
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests8.descript: &7Now that you got that workbench, let's start carving!
&7Carve whatever design you want, let's try it with the structure to see if we can summon their leader.
&e- Crow's Guide to Destroy the Scarecrows, Page 7
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests8.title: &eFancy Carving (Page 7)
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests9.descript: &7Then, try as many carved jack o lanterns as you can, until that bastard shows up.
&e- Crow's Guide to Destroy the Scarecrows, Page 8
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests9.subtitle: &8[Click to read the Guide Page]
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests9.title: &eSummoning the Bastard (Page 8)
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests10.descrip: &7The leader of the Scarecrows, \"Sir Scar Crow\", named after once getting scarred by a Crow, and because it rhymes with scarecrow, apparently.
&7He's a bit of a coward, will run away from you and attack you from the distance, while summoning undead beings to attack you.
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests10.title: &fï€° &e&lSir Scar Crow
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests11.descrip: &7Thank you, Flameborn, for helping us destroy this bastard for once.
&7As a reward we will give you his weapon, which we stole from him a few years ago out of sheer luck. He's extremely dangerous with it so you were lucky to not fight him like that.
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests11.title: &eLetter from The Crows
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests12.descrip: &7\"What would happen if I give him his weapon back?\" You think...
&dThe essence of Sir Scar Crow held upon the Void Hourglass contains a reflection of him with his weapon, The Scarred Night.
&cFinish the Void's Invasion campaign and unlock Mythic Bosses to fight this boss. Only available through October 20th to November 14th.
prom2.the_scarred_night.quests12.title: &fï &d&lSir Scar Crow (Mythic)
prom2.the_scarred_night.title: &cThe Scarred Night
